**Job Description:**

The GTB Delivery Team within the **TDS Data, Delivery and Integration** group is responsible for end-to-end delivery of projects impacting the Global Transaction Banking (GTB) business of TD Securities (TDS). Projects in this space will be in support of various business-driven, regulatory, and industry initiatives. To deliver on this mandate, the team partners closely with stakeholder groups from across TD including members of the GTB businesses, GTB technology, Operations, Compliance, Legal, Risk, Payments Technology and others.


As a **Vice President, Change Delivery** , you will be responsible for helping your teams adopt appropriate agile practices that increases their effectiveness and efficiency. You will play a pivotal role in facilitating the Agile development process and empowering our team to deliver high-quality products on time.


**JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES**

* Leading Agile Delivery for complex initiatives across multiple teams, leveraging appropriate agile practices and blending different delivery methodologies for maximum impact
* Fostering a high-performing and collaborative environment
* Driving continuous improvement and removing impediments at the program level
* Mentoring junior scrum masters
* Facilitate all scrum meetings including Sprint Planning, Daily Stand-up, Sprint Review, and Retrospective.
* Coach and mentor technology and product leaders on the effective application of agile concepts.

**QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS / EXPERIENCES**

* 7+ years of experience as a scrum master for multiple agile development teams and leading complex initiatives in an agile environment.
* Experience with multiple delivery methodologies and an ability to blend them appropriately when needed.
* Experience with cloud enablement initiatives and driving successful outcomes in extremely technical situations.
* Demonstrate deep practical understanding of multiple frameworks (scrum and Kanban), agile values and principles.
* Strong Leadership skills and ability to influence stakeholders, including Product and Technology Leaders.
* Creative problem-solving skills, leveraging extensive experience to navigate and resolve complex challenges and team dynamics.
* Strong track record of leveraging agile metrics.
* Ability to forecast and plan using agile practices.
* Advanced agile certifications like CSP, PSM-3, ICP-ACC an asset.
* Experience in Global Transaction Banking an asset.

**Who We Are**

TD Securities offers a wide range of capital markets products and services to corporate, government, and institutional clients who choose us for our innovation, execution, and experience. With more than 6,500 professionals operating out of 40 cities across the globe, we help clients meet their needs today and prepare for tomorrow. Our services include underwriting and distributing new issues, providing trusted advice and industry-leading insight, extending access to global markets, and delivering integrated transaction banking solutions. In 2023, we acquired Cowen Inc., offering our clients access to a premier U.S. equities business and highly-diverse equity research franchise, while growing our strong, diversified investment bank. We are growth-oriented, people-focused, and community-minded. As a team, we work to deliver value for our clients every day.

title: Slab Sales /Slab Gallery Admin
description:
**SUMMARY** The primary responsibility of the Slab Sales / Slab Gallery Admin is the generate significant targeted sales in stone. This employee will build and maintain relationships with dealers, kitchen dealers and coworkers; and will create efficiencies through data mining, follow-up and market research. The Slab Sales / Slab Gallery Admin will cost effectively move, combine and ship merchandise in a timely manner by exercising sound judgment managing relationships with vendors and suppliers. This employee is to accurately and productively satisfy customer requests, pull orders, handle returns, and maintain inventory integrity.

**ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES** 

1. To cost-effectively turn, move, ship, administer, and coordinate receiving inventory.

2. Preparation and submittal of related visitations, travel logs and incurred expenses.

3. To maintain, manage and archive reports and logs.

4. To utilize shipping software and/or documentation in the creation of shipping labels.

5. To utilize customer/inventory software and create pulling labels and packing slips.

6. To report inventory counts, inaccuracies and damages to the Warehouse Supervisor.

7. To build, manage and further market penetration of existing accounts.

8. To develop rewarding sales prospects; to align and manage time accordingly.

9. To effectively introduce new products and lines.

10. To troubleshoot and provide outstanding customer care.

11. To liaise with colleagues on payment collections.

12. To accurately administer, process, partner with and follow-up on all orders.

13. To build and foster relationships with dealers, kitchen dealers, owners and personnel.

14. To continuously maintain exemplary housekeeping standards.

15. To follow company policies and procedures, including best practices guidelines and workplace ethics.

16. To perform other duties as assigned.

title: Political Canvasser
description:
Legion Outreach Consulting is looking for canvassers who are outgoing, personable, and eager to canvass on a political campaign in Queens and Long Island.

**Description:**

We are knocking on doors to persuade residents to vote for candidates in preparation for the General Election.

Shifts will run seven days a week until Election Day, November 5th. Pay is $25/hr.

* Monday through Friday the shifts run 4PM to 8PM; Saturdays and Sundays the shifts run from 11AM to 3PM. There is a possibility of double shifts on Saturdays and Sundays.
* Canvassers are required to work a minimum of 3 shifts per week, but are encouraged to sign up for more.
* There is a 3-strike policy to curtail flaking on scheduled shifts, for lateness, and for underperformance.
* Canvasser performance is evaluated based on the number of doors knocked in a single shift as well as the number of interactions that result in support for the candidate.
* Canvassers will arrive 30 minutes early on the day of their first shift to go through training.

**Qualifications:**

* Personable, outgoing, can easily talk to strangers
* Can take and follow instructions quickly
* Proficient in data entry
* Bilingual preferred
* A car is required, as you will be on the move
* Comfortable talking about politics

**Job Type:**

Part-time, Temporary

**Salary:**

$25/hr

**Must be able to work a minimum of 3 shifts a week.**

**Experience:**

* 1 year of canvassing preferred

If you have any other questions, please email us at hiringoffice@meridiancampaigns.com

title: Grants Manager
description:
**COMPANY INFORMATION**

Maspeth Town Hall is a thriving community center providing a variety of educational, cultural, and recreational services. These include After School and Summer Camp programming, toddler play groups, and senior-focused classes. We proudly serve families from all ethnic and cultural backgrounds in Maspeth and surrounding neighborhoods.

**POSITION SUMMARY**

The Grants Manager will be responsible for managing the grant lifecycle from award through closeout, including contract agreements and financial reporting for MTH grants and affiliated organizations. They prepare contract documents for registration. The Grants Manager will also monitor spending levels for each grant so they are aligned with fiscal year budgets.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

**Grant Management & Financial Administration:**

* Prepare and submit documents for contract and amendment registration.
* Initiate subcontractor or vendor agreements in accordance with contract guidelines.
* Serve as primary point of contact between MTH and affiliated organizations.
* Serve as a liaison between affiliated organizations and funders.
* Assist with budget preparation and submission in accordance with fiscal policies.
* Initiate budget modifications as needed.
* Monitor contract spending and raise awareness, concerns or recommendations as appropriate to ensure reimbursements are maximized.
* Review and analyze the reasonableness of expenditures in accordance with fiscal policies.
* Prepare and submit expense reports on a monthly, quarterly, annual basis with required supporting documentation.
* Assist with audit inquiries related to grants as needed.

**Grant Procurement & Compliance:**

* Prepare grant proposals and applications for city and state agencies.
* Coordinate with affiliated organizations to gather necessary information and data for grant applications.
* Monitor award and/or contract status through city and state reports and portals.
* Submit prequalification applications and renewals for city and state agencies.
* Maintain account credentials for grant applications on behalf of the affiliated organizations.
* Submit year end reports and desk reviews.
* Attend professional development trainings as needed.
* Perform other duties as assigned, within the scope of practice.

**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor's Degree in accounting, finance, or related field from an accredited institution or equivalent experience required.
* Licensed Notary Public in New York State, or willingness to acquire one.

title: Floating Residential Coordinator
description:
**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Morris, Bergen, and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

We are currently seeking a **Full Time Floating Residential Coordinator** for our programs in **Bergen County, Morris County, Somerset County** **and Warren County**. The Residential Coordinator will oversee **all** group homes serving individuals with developmental, intellectual and physical disabilities.

description:

South Plainfield, NJ 08070

We are a high volume print and direct-mail firm. We are looking for someone to perform material control activities in a 5S lean environment to support the manufacturing group with its goal of meeting on-time delivery and quality objectives.

**Some of the tasks for the Warehouse Operator position include but are not limited to;**

Prepare and expedite all items / pallets for shipping and receiving, adhering to delivery date requirements as well as customer specifications.

Complete and or review all documentation (packing slips / bills of lading) and all other pertinent documents required for shipping/receiving for accuracy.

title: Registered Dietitian
description:
Job Title: Registered Dietitian

Location: Bronx, NY

Blended Rate: $2400/wk

Shift: 5x8s - 40hrs - Days

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a dynamic and skilled Registered Dietitian to join our team in Bronx, NY. As a Registered Dietitian, you will play a crucial role in providing comprehensive nutrition care to our clients, helping them achieve their health and wellness goals. Your expertise in nutrition and dietary management will be instrumental in delivering personalized diet plans, providing nutritional counseling, and promoting healthy eating habits.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct thorough assessments of clients' dietary needs, medical conditions, and lifestyle factors to develop individualized nutrition care plans.
* Monitor clients' progress regularly and adjust nutrition plans as needed to ensure optimal outcomes.
* Provide evidence-based nutritional counseling to clients, addressing their specific health concerns and promoting healthy eating habits.
* Educate clients on proper nutrition and dietary modifications, taking into account cultural, social, and emotional factors.
* Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure integrated care plans that address all aspects of clients' health and well-being.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest research and trends in nutrition and dietary guidelines, incorporating evidence-based practices into client care.
* Provide nutrition education and training to staff members, promoting a culture of healthy eating within the organization.
* Participate in community outreach programs and health events to raise awareness about the importance of proper nutrition and dietary management.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of client assessment, progress, and interventions in compliance with healthcare regulations and standards.
* Adhere to professional ethics and conduct in accordance with the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics' Code of Ethics.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Nutrition, Dietetics, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Registered Dietitian (RD) certification from the Commission on Dietetic Registration.
* Current membership in the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics.
* Demonstrated experience in providing nutrition counseling and developing tailored diet plans.
* Strong knowledge of medical nutrition therapy and the ability to interpret lab results and medical history data.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to establish rapport with clients and collaborate effectively with healthcare teams.
* Proficient in using computer software and electronic health record systems.
* Ability to work independently, demonstrate critical thinking, and make sound clinical judgments.
* Willingness to stay updated on the latest research and regulations in the field of nutrition and dietetics.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

If you are passionate about nutrition, have a desire to make a positive impact on clients' lives, and meet the above qualifications, please apply with your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and interest in the position. We look forward to reviewing your application.

**Working for Seven Healthcare:**

Seven Healthcare is one of the USA's most popular agencies for Registered Dietitian jobs. Rated ‘Excellent’ on Trustpilot from 1900+ reviews, and with 20 major awards behind us, we take pride in knowing we can find you the best possible rates in a role you can be proud of.

title: Recruiter - Northeast
description:
**Position Overview**

The Talent Acquisition Recruiter for will partner with HR and retail leaders to execute strategic and creative recruiting strategies to attract and hire top retail talent.


The Talent Acquisition Recruiter must be able to think strategically while also being hands-on in overseeing the day-to-day execution of the agreed upon strategy with a focus on clients, people, and brand desirability. They will be open and approachable and will work with both the central team and the local teams in a transparent, united and mutually supportive manner. They must model and champion our core belief; People Make the Difference and our values; Be Creative & Innovative, Deliver Excellence and Cultivate an Entrepreneurial Spirit.”


**Key Accountabilities**

* Proactively partner with Human Resources Business Partner and Store leadership to understand unique talent needs.
* Provide strategic and creative methodologies for recruiting top talent.
* Conduct full cycle retail recruitment activities, including sourcing candidates, posting positions, and screening talent.
* Help build leadership pipeline for future retail roles.
* Offer options on sourcing techniques, including investigating new technologies and practices for reaching top talent.
* Maximize opportunities with social media and LinkedIn.
* Consult with HR partners on specific staffing strategies for volume hiring, hard-to-fill positions, background check standards and agency resources.
* Act as a consultative partner to the retail market specifically with our Client Advisor Population
* Champion diversity hiring by incorporating inclusive practices into every stage of the recruitment process.
* Engage with diverse professional groups and educational institutions to promote opportunities within the company.
* Serve as an advisor on change management initiatives related to organizational restructuring or shifts in strategic direction that impact staffing.
* Coach hiring managers on best practices for assessing candidates' potential beyond immediate job requirements by considering long-term value addition.
* Establish collaborative partnerships across all levels of the organization, influencing decision-making through robust analysis and expert guidance on talent issues.

**Qualifications**

**Required**

* At least 5-7 years of high volume, professional recruiting experience.
* Knowledge of related business issues, trends, and best practices as it relates to talent acquisition.
* Strong relationship management and influencing skills and demonstrated ability to build relationships.
* Strong customer-service orientation, ability to prioritize multiple initiatives and desire to deliver end to end solutions.
* Excellent technical skills; in-depth knowledge of applicant tracking technology and general Microsoft applications; familiarity with best practices in social networking; ability to leverage technology to attract candidates and drive effective and efficient operations.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong organizational skills; ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.

**Preferred**

* Industry experience in retail, consumer products or service industry preferred (Retail, Luxury, or multi-brand).
* Experience providing HR support in a field location or through other HR Professionals.
* Prior high volume recruitment experience.

The hiring range for this position ranges from $97,665 -$132,135. The rate of pay offered will be dependent upon candidates’ relevant skills and experience.

title: Regional Sales Manager - NY Metro/ N New Jersey
description:
**Who we are:**

At Luminys Systems Corporation, we combined exceptional customer service with cutting-edge technology to furnish our clients with superior solutions and services. Our all-encompassing offerings feature a broad array of components, such as security systems and video management software and beyond. This dual commitment to ongoing innovation in technology along with unwavering partner support ensures we provide top-notch quality, dependability, and stability for both our direct customers and our network of resellers.

**What you will be doing:**

Your primary focus will be to deliver our company's message of industry leading IP and CCTV equipment into the security market space. You will develop strong partnerships with system integrators, end users and specifying consultants within a defined geographical location. You will call on new and existing accounts, being the subject matter expert on our various products. You will present our security offering by utilizing live product demonstrations at customer locations including the deployment of corporate assigned distribution roll outs and programs.

**Your territory coverage:**

New York Metro Area, N. New Jersey

**What your primary responsibilities will be:**

* Develop and manage a network of system integrators, end users, consultants and distribution partners to achieve company goals
* Team player mentality with excellent communication skills
* Develop and implement a regional specific business plan for each fiscal year to ensure profitable growth
* Provide timely project forecasting through utilization of CRM
* Lead or present our products at sales and technical trainings
* Develop and maintain contacts with major customers within region and actively participate in major selling situations including consultant engineering and owner presentations
* Continually monitor distributor performance against nationwide standard and make recommendations for changes when appropriate
* Coordinate cross territory business activities
* Communicate and implement best practices across assigned region
* Assists in all trade shows and/or specialized training seminars.

**What you will need:** 

* Bachelor Degree in business or 3+ years of industry experience
* 3+ years of sales experience with CCTV, security products, or access control products
* Technical competence with both Access Control and CCTV products and solutions
* Working knowledge of office software applications and sales automation tools

title: Experienced Premium Auditor
description:
ARMStrong Receivable Management is the leading and most trusted name in the world of debt recovery and financial solutions. With a track record of excellence and reliability, we have proudly served businesses across various industries for decades, ensuring efficient B2B collections and tailored debt recovery solutions. As the parent company, ARMStrong is proud to own and operate Altus Receivables Management, Amalgamated Financial Group, Brown & Joseph, Paragon, CP Audits, and SubroIQ, each a powerhouse in their own right, providing specialized expertise in debt management and financial services.  

  

NEIS is seeking Premium Auditors as we continue to grow our team! Premium Auditors examines the financial records of insurance companies to make sure they are following laws and regulations. As a premium auditor, looking for evidence of fraud and checking that insurance companies adhere to these regulations are your primary responsibilities. Your job will be based from home with required daily travel to each audit location. Car travel will be on average of 4 days per week within your assigned territory.  

  

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Conduct insurance premium audits for Workers Compensation, General Liability, and Automobile policies by auditing policyholder’s records, and applying manual rules and company standards.
* Prepare for the audit by identifying the necessary information and type of records needed
* Prepare schedule to maximize optimal use of time
* Correspond with insured via phone, email and mail to setup audit appointments.
* Examine the policyholder’s records, gather data to determine correct classifications for business activities and write an effective description of operations
* Prepare complete audit document, explain results to insured and communicate the results to the home office
* Travel to multiple audit locations daily/weekly

**Job Requirements:**

* Associate’s Degree or equivalent plus two years’ performing premium audits or equivalent combination of education and experience highly desired – **Entry level also considered for those willing to learn**
* Ability to read, analyze and interpret financial documents
* General PC knowledge including Microsoft Excel and Word. Knowledge of Visual Audit is a plus.
* Ability to communicate well with customers and staff.
* Valid driver’s license and satisfactory driving record

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* Benefit package with health, dental, vision, life and disability coverage options
* 401(k) retirement plan option with company matching
* Generous paid time off policy and 7 paid holidays
* Salary is $44,700 - $55,000 (greatly depending on experience)
* Weekly pay
* 401(k) plan with company matching and immediate vesting


We look forward to you joining the team!


Armstrong Receivable Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Bergen, Morris, Warren and Somerset Counties. title: Marketing Analytics Intern – Paid Fall 2024
description:
**Summary**  

Open Road Integrated Media is a prestige content brand delivering digital experiences that entertain and inform readers around the world. The Open Road network of digital properties produces compelling stories that keep audiences engaged — across devices, content verticals, and global territories.  

  

Open Road Integrated Media includes several business areas that work in tandem to connect audiences with great stories: we publish a catalog of ebooks by bestselling authors such as Alice Walker and Michael Chabon, and our Ignition program markets ebooks from external publishers. The Early Bird Books newsletter delivers daily ebook deals, and our content newsletters and websites—The Lineup, The Portalist, The Archive, Murder & Mayhem, and A Love so True—circulate articles and deals to more niche audiences.  

  

The Marketing Analytics team is focused on utilizing sales and performance data to optimize our efforts and maximize revenue growth. We are responsible for strategizing and executing retail promotions and digital advertising campaigns.  

  

Our team is looking to hire one intern to work 20 hours per week. This position pays $16.00 per hour. This role will assist in a number of tasks, such as: gathering data and preparing reports on various marketing initiatives, such as social media advertising and retail promotions; helping to assess campaign results and derive actionable insights; planning and executing digital ad campaigns, including writing copy, determining optimal targeting, developing creative; and maintaining marketing grids. This role will report to the Marketing Analytics Manager and will work closely with members of the Marketing Analytics team.  

  

In addition to analytical skills and an interest in data, the ideal candidate will possess strong writing skills and a knowledge of books. We are a small, fast-paced group, so proactivity, hyper-organization and attention to detail—while still having your eye on the big picture—are key.  

  

**Essential Functions*** Pull data and prepare reports on marketing campaigns, email newsletters, and social media advertising campaigns
* Measure the impact of digital marketing efforts, leveraging internal and third-party analytics tools
* Create and edit advertising and promotional campaigns
* Data entry and upkeep of various grids

**Requirements*** Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including VLookup, pivot tables, and charts)
* Strong organizational skills, time management, and meticulous attention to detail
* Knowledge of data visualization and analytics tools such Tableau a plus
* Familiarity with online marketing platforms– Meta Ads Manager (Facebook and Instagram), Amazon Advertising, TikTok Ads Manager, and related advertising metrics a plus
* Experience with Canva and in-app video creation (e.g. Tiktok, Instagram) a plus
* A knowledge and love of books and reading
* This position will be a hybrid of remote work and limited office attendance (at least 2 days in office) in New York City, NY.

title: Property Manager
description:
BNE Real Estate Group is a national, family-owned organization with over 70 years of experience in the development, investment, ownership and management of high-quality and vastly diversified real estate assets. We are seeking an experienced Property Manager who demonstrates a high-level of customer service and excellent attention to detail.

The Property Manager is responsible for directing the day to day operations of the community and ensuring that the asset is meeting the financial objectives of ownership and management.

Manage Others: yes

# of Properties: 1

Responsibilities/Essential Functions:

Personnel Management

* Has the authority to hire, fire, advance, promote or change the status of the employees that report to him/her and/or makes recommendations to senior management regarding these decisions.
* Consistently use successful techniques and company directives to screen, hire, orient and train new personnel
* Ensure efficiency of staff through ongoing training, instruction, counseling and leadership
* Plan weekly/daily office staff schedules and assignments
* Coordinate maintenance schedule and assignments with Maintenance Supervisor
* Administer action plans consistently, and on a timely basis regarding employee performance problems. Document appropriately and communicate situation with supervisor, Human Resources and terminate properly when necessary.
* Provide support to staff to encourage team work and lead as an example in creating a harmonious environment
* Ensure all administrative processes involving personnel are handled on a timely basis (i.e., performance evaluations, salary reviews, time sheets, change of status forms, etc.)

Financial

* Interpret financial goals and operate asset in owners’ best interest in accordance with Policies & Procedures Manual
* Maintain accurate records of all community transactions and submit on timely basis (i.e., rent rolls, delinquency reports, move-in/move-outs, etc.)
* Prepare annual budgets and income projections in a timely and accurate manner
* Assist in the preparation of monthly financial reports, as required
* Plan long and short-term capital expenditures
* Ensure that all rents and late fees/check charges are collected, posted and deposited in a timely manner
* Generate necessary legal action, documents and process in accordance with State and Company guidelines
* Provide constant vendor/contractor communications concerning scheduling, billing, vendor relations and certificates of insurance
* Ensure that A/P invoices are submitted to the corporate office for payment, handle petty cash and all funds

Leasing

* Implement policies and practices to ensure property is rented to its fullest capacity
* Develop marketing strategies to secure prospective residents
* Confirm that leasing staff techniques are effective in obtaining a closing
* Confirm that leasing staff gather information about market competition in the area
* Continually monitor and analyze traffic logs, conversion ratios, budget guidelines, renewal information, marketing data, etc., to be able to give up-to-date and proper information when requested by others
* Manage social networking websites

Resident Retention

* Respond and resolve resident concerns, complaints and requests in a timely manner to ensure resident satisfaction
* Develop and implement resident retention programs (i.e., resident functions, special promotions, monthly newsletters, etc.).
* Ensure the distribution of all company or community-issued notices (i.e., bad weather, emergency, etc.)
* Consistently implement policies of the property

Maintenance

* Oversee the community appearance and supervise maintenance personnel to ensure that work orders and apartment turnovers are completed on a timely basis.

Administrative

* Prepare and implement procedures and systems within company guidelines to ensure orderly, efficient workflow
* Waive or deviate from established policies and procedure for the betterment of the property
* Confirm all leases and corresponding paperwork are completed and input to software system accurately and on a timely basis
* Ensure current resident files are properly maintained by performing monthly file audits
* Ensure all administrative paperwork is accurate, complete and submitted on a timely basis
* Lead emergency team for community. Ensure proper response and handling of all community emergencies with staff, residents, buildings, etc. within company guidelines to minimize liabilities (i.e., criminal activity on community, employee/resident injuries, fires, floods, freezes, etc.)

Safety

* Learn and ensure compliance with all company, local, state and federal safety rules
* Ensure that unsafe conditions are corrected in a timely manner
* Direct staff to follow a “safety first” principle

Physical/Mental Demands

* The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus.
* Effectively read, think, organize, analyze and perform mathematical calculation

Qualifications:

* BS degree in related field
* 3+ years’ experience in property management
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Proficient in computer programs, including Microsoft Office and Yardi
* Ability to work with minimal supervision
* Well organized with excellent time management skills
* An in-depth knowledge of all rules, regulations and laws regarding property management
* Valid NJ real estate salesperson license
* Maintain regular and punctual attendance
* Work hours as required to complete assignments/projects
* Travel overnight as required
* Comply with all company policies and procedures
* Professional Image
* Strong Verbal Skills
* Strong customer service orientation

Our services extend to families experiencing homelessness, survivors of domestic violence, people living with HIV/AIDS, veterans, youth aging out of foster care, adults with behavioral health or substance use needs, and others in need, including a special education preschool program.

title: Vice President and GM of CCS
description:
Vice President and General Manager of Care Coordination Services
  
  

**Classification:** Exempt
  
**Supervisor:** Chief Operating Officer
  
  

**Summary of Position:**  

The Vice President and General Manager of Care Coordination Services (CCS) is an experienced Operations executive who will generate significant impact through the strategic and tactical direction of the CCS business, overseeing both domestic and global resources. The VP/GM of CCS will work with the Directors and Managers to provide guidance, insight and improve management methods. Based on goals of the organization and working with cross functional counterparts, this professional will be responsible for overseeing the revenue generation and cost management of the CCS business, including product creation and optimal use of global resources. Additionally, the CCS leader will review the optimization of workflow, resource management, and reporting to generate strategies to implement new and improved existing processes and procedures that will attain growth and profit for the business. This position will report directly to the Chief Operating Officer.
  
  

**Performance Metrics based around:**  

* KPIs
* Revenue growth
* Gross Margin
* Customer Satisfaction/Retention – Net Promoter Score
* Employee Satisfaction/Retention – Employee Survey
* Platform Migration (Integration), when applicable - Measure Plan in Comparison to Actual
* Process Optimization and defect reduction leveraging Lean Six Sigma for Technical & Workflow Improvements
* Augmentation (Domestic and Global) Measure Goals vs Actual – Timeline
* Product Creation – New and Enhanced Offerings Focused on Tech Enabled Services and Partnership


**Duties & Responsibilities:**  

* Mentor and support company Directors and Managers in support of various clients. This includes building relationships throughout the organization, providing a resource for escalation of issues, developing strategic programs and product offerings to grow accounts. Provide sales support as needed.
* Define and implement a CCS Performance Management approach, including determining if incentives are appropriate/needed to drive results.
* Nurture and develop cross functional relationships with peers and other resources in Sales, Marketing, IT, Finance, Technology, and Human Resources to meet or exceed business objectives.
* Schedule onsite client visits on a regular basis and follow up with detailed recommendations for improvements for the client and CCS overall.
* Create the CCS budget and monitor costs, employee productivity, and achievement of KPIs.
* Participate in vendor negotiations.
* Partner with the VP/GM of ROI to coordinate compliance, implementations, training, global resources, quality, Lean Six Sigma, technology, and other programs as appropriate.
* Responsible for strategic planning and execution to enhance profitability, productivity, and efficiency; assist the overall CCS team in meeting facility revenue goals.
* Develop customer and employee satisfaction programs and direct feedback response.
* Conduct annual meetings with directors to set Goals and objectives and meet regularly to ensure Directors and Managers are meeting operational objectives.
* Work closely with Marketing to provide ongoing feedback on client satisfaction reports and work to obtain client case study partners for ongoing marketing and sales efforts.
* Provide strategic direction in regularly scheduled Product Management calls/meetings to contribute valuable client feedback on Verisma products and services.
* Partner with the Training department ensuring that new hire and ongoing programs drive employees to excellence. Support technology to expand reach of training.
* Manage and track client at risk and retention reports.
* Live by and promote Verisma Core Values.


**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, management, or related field required. Master’s degree preferred
* 15+ years in management and directing both onsite, remote and global employees
* Experience in healthcare operations, specifically working with regulatory issues, policy development, compliance, and investigation resolution with a strong focus on direct executive client management
* Experience with Release of Information preferred
* Demonstrated expertise in creation and implementation of operational KPIs, standard operating procedures (SOPs)
* Demonstrated creative problem-solving skills in an operational environment
* Possess the administrative and management skills necessary to direct organizational programs and supervise management, professional and hourly staff
* Hold independent judgment and analytical skills to be able to provide sound recommendations
* Be able to participate and present effectively and concisely in Senior Executive leadership communications and meetings, up to and including to the board
* Demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interact with representatives of client organizations, including their senior business leaders and staff in a tactful and positive manner
* Ability to work cross functionally in a fast-paced environment with a "Can do" attitude in approaching challenges, and lead the charge to address ‘unbounded’ problems to reach a solution
* Ability to handle confidential information


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Tax Compliance Manager
description:
We connect professionals with rewarding opportunities in the Several field. We are dedicated to supporting our clients with top-tier talent and providing our candidates with career-advancing roles.

**Job Title:** Tax Compliance Manager

**Location:** Morristown, NJ

**Duration:** Permanent

**Summary:**

We are seeking an experienced Tax Compliance Manager with over 5 years of expertise in federal and state income tax, particularly in compliance and reporting. The role involves managing federal pro-forma tax returns, federal consolidated tax return filings, and state/locality returns. Key responsibilities also include income tax provisioning under US GAAP, managing tax audits, and mentoring junior staff. Proficiency in tax tools like CorpTax and Alteryx, along with a strong understanding of Microsoft Excel and Word, is essential. This role offers the opportunity to make a significant impact in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Review federal pro-forma tax returns and supporting work papers using CorpTax.
* Ensure timely filing of Client's federal consolidated tax returns.
* Oversee state and local tax return preparation and review.
* Manage and mentor an income tax associate.
* Assist with federal and state income tax audits and resolve tax notices.
* Coordinate tax payments and review quarterly federal and state tax estimates and extensions.

**Tax Reporting:**

* Assist with quarterly and annual US GAAP income tax provisions.
* Review income tax account reconciliations, book-tax difference calculations, and deferred tax asset/liability work papers.
* Support documentation of internal tax controls.

**Additional Duties:**

* Support cash tax management, business support, and corporate projects.
* Drive efficiency and simplicity in tax functions through process standardization and technology utilization.
* Liaise with external tax advisors on relevant matters.

**Must-Have Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of federal and state income tax experience.
* Strong technical expertise in tax compliance and reporting.
* Proficiency in CorpTax, Alteryx, and MS Office tools.
* Excellent communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.

**Education:**

* Degree in Finance/Accounting preferred; CPA or Master's in Taxation is a plus.

**Benefits:**

* Comprehensive health insurance (medical, dental, vision).
* Retirement plans, life insurance, and equity options.
* Generous paid time off and wellness programs.
* Opportunities for continuous learning and career development.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Government Pricing Analyst
description:
* **Job Title- Government Pricing Senior Analyst**
* **Location- Interpace Parkway, Parsippany, NJ 07054 (Hybrid)**
* **Duration- 9+ months (Temp. to Perm.)**
* **Pay: $60/hr - $100/hr based on experience**
* **Schedule: Monday – Friday 8:00am – 5:00pm**
* **Client – Pharmaceuticals**

**Position Summary**  
The primary role of the GP Senior Analyst is to perform, validate and submit pricing under the Medicaid Drug Rebate Program, Medicare Modernization Act, and Sections 602 and 603 of the Veterans Healthcare Act, including Average Manufacturer’s Price (“AMP”), Best Price (“BP”), 340B ceiling price (“340B”), Non-Federal Average Manufacturer’s Price (“nFAMP”) and the Federal Ceiling Price (“FCP”). The GP Senior Analyst will be responsible for researching/validating data anomalies & variances and must have deep analytical and Excel skills.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities Percentage of Time**

* Run monthly, quarterly & annual GP price calculations in ModelN GP.
* Perform in-depth analyses to identify data anomalies.
* Responsible for researching/validating prior period variances/trends/outliers. Creates summary reports for management review.
* Submit pricing to DDR, VA & other government agencies as required 70%
* Assist in preparing documents/reports/analysis needed for pre-certification reviews with executive management 20%
* Assist with annual Public Law 102-585 process including, annual nFAMP, FCP, request for modification (“RFM”)/price proposals 10%

**Core Essential Skill sets:**

* Minimum of 2 years’ experience in Government Pricing calculations
* Prior Government Pricing experience; preferably in processing and reviewing various price types, ie, AMP, BP, ASP
* Strong analytical skills
* Strong excel skills and power point
* A Plus if prior experience in Revitas classic and FLEX

**Education:**

Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in Business, Finance, Accounting or related fields or equivalent combination of education, training and/or direct work-related experience

**Experience required:** 

Minimum three (3) + year’s prior experience in Government pricing pharmaceutical/consulting role working with large manufacturers with both brands and generics. Hands-on working knowledge of Revitas GP, Flex and SAP. Thorough understanding of Government pricing regulations and a hands-on role in the analysis and validation of multiple price types

title: Account Manager - Supply
description:
**Hybrid*** **New York****,****New York****,****United States**

**Smaato, Business**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


  
### **Job description**

**Who We Are**  

Verve Group has created a more efficient and privacy-focused way to buy and monetize advertising. Verve Group is an ecosystem of demand and supply technologies fusing data, media, and technology together to deliver results and growth to both advertisers and publishers–no matter the screen or location, no matter who, what, or where a customer is. With 13 offices across the globe and with an eye on servicing forward-thinking advertising customers, Verve Group’s solutions are trusted by more than 90 of the United States’ top 100 advertisers, 4,000 publishers globally, and the world’s top demand-side platforms. Verve Group is a subsidiary of Media and Games Invest (MGI).

  

Smaato’s digital ad tech platform is the only omnichannel ad server and monetization solution with controls to make monetization simple. Publishers can bring their first-party data and manage all inventory in one place. Marketers get access to the highest-quality inventory so they can reach audiences around the world and on any device. Smaato is part of Verve Group, a subsidiary of Media and Games Invest (MGI). For more information, log on to www.smaato.com.

 **Who You Are**



As an Account Manager, Supply, you will oversee a portfolio of accounts within the US, focusing on building and nurturing relationships with Publisher partners. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate across various teams, ensuring successful partner management, onboarding, optimization, and upselling.

 **This position can be occupied in New York City in a hybrid set-up (Tue, Wed, Thu in the office) or filled remotely in one of the following states: California, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Massachusetts, Maryland,, New Jersey, Tennessee, Texas, and Utah.**

 **What You Will Do**


* Establish and maintain trusted relationships with Publisher partners, ensuring open communication through status calls and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)
* Understand client challenges, capabilities, and goals to drive long-term partnership value by identifying growth opportunities and making optimization recommendations
* Grow revenue and manage a book of business with existing supply partners, analyzing revenue and performance data using internal dashboards to ensure targets are met. Proactively provide solutions if targets are missed or projected to be off
* Communicate revenue opportunities to internal teams and execute them promptly, working closely with Finance, Operations, Publisher, Product, and Technology groups to ensure partners receive best-in-class service
* Oversee all aspects of partner onboarding and post-launch management
* Develop tailored revenue growth strategies for each publisher
* Upsell current activities by introducing new products
* Collect client feedback on improvements and new features, sharing insights with the team to inform future strategies.
### **Job requirements**

**What You Will Bring**


* 2+ years of previous account management & sales experience at a digital / web / online advertising / media company
* A solid understanding of the adtech ecosystem; in-app, web, and CTV environments and a solid understanding of advertising terminologies including pricing structures (CPA, CPC, CPM, etc.)
* Demonstrable expertise in Demand Side Platforms (DSP), Supply Side Platforms (SSP), and Private Marketplaces (PMP)
* Proven experience managing a book of business within the adtech industry, demonstrating successful account growth and revenue generation.
* Proactive, autonomous professional who prioritizes tasks independently and takes ownership
* Possesses a strong understanding of the agency and advertiser landscape, with the ability to communicate effectively with vendors
* Self-motivated individual with a passion for working in a customer-centric, fast-evolving, and often ambiguous industry
* Proven ability to troubleshoot and solve problems
* Excellent skills in prioritization, interpersonal communication, and presentations
* Keen attention to detail and the ability to envision the long-term potential of each business opportunity
* Maintains high ethical standards and integrity
* Strong analytical skills with a passion for optimization

 **What We Offer**


* Join one of the top privacy-first omnichannel ad platforms and gaming companies
* Be part of a multicultural team (55+ nationalities) that is bringing advertising to the next level
* Benefit from working with some of the most experienced professionals in our industry and constantly grow with us
* You will learn and evolve in an empowering environment characterized by entrepreneurial actions
* Responsibility, independence, and an opportunity to participate in projects that have a significant impact on Verve Group’s success
* 3 Wellness days per year to help you maintain your well-being (in Q1, Q2, and Q3 after min. 90 days of employment)
* Enhance your professional skills with a yearly training budget and improve your language skills through German and/or English classes.
* Work and Travel Program (monthly raffle after 2 years of employment)
* We are happy to build a great team together and we appreciate your help through our Employee Referral Bonus
* Align your interests with the company's success and take part in our Employee Shares Purchase Plan
* You will be entitled to 12 holidays per year and unlimited PTO in addition to any of the public/bank holidays
* 401(k) Retirement plan with company match
* Comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance
* Personalized Benefits Platform; with a budget of 100 USD/month, you can choose the benefits that fit you best from the following options:
	+ Internet allowance
	+ Meal plan services
	+ Spa services
	+ Fitness classes & subscriptions
	+ Travel credits
* You receive support from us through our Employee Assistance Program and Parental Leave
* Medical & Dependent Care FSA & Commuter Benefits
* Accident Insurance, Pet Insurance, and Identity Theft Protection



Verve Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

  

The annual on-target-earning (OTE) salary range for this position is USD 90k-120k. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

title: Shake Shack Assistant Manager
description:
**Assistant General Manager**

**What We Do**

At Applegreen, we\\_ **Refresh Travelers on their Journey***\\_….* ApplegreenUSA operates over 80 travel plazas across the Northeast and Midwest that provide convenience, comfort, retail, and an extensive range of delicious food options such as Auntie Anne’s, Burger King, Chick-fil-A, Cinnabon, Dunkin Donuts, Panda Express, Panera, Popeyes, Pret, Shake Shack, Starbucks, and many more.

**Our Core Values**

Our Core Values are what we stand for. They guide and motivate our attitudes and behaviors to our customers, our suppliers, our business partners, and each other.

* Our customers and communities are at the *heart* of everything we do.
* We value and develop our *people*.
* We are driven by *pace*, passion and performance.
* We seek opportunities and embrace *change*.

**Benefits**

**What You’ll Do**

The Assistant General Manager helps the General Manager to ensure that day-to-day business operations run smoothly. This position provides an opportunity for entry-level managers to learn important management skills and practice judgment and discretion skills.

**ROLE PRIORITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Responsible for confidently delivering performance feedback, set goals, foster teamwork, and clearly communicate business objectives.

title: Cashier - Wine Shop
description:
Hi! I'm Ryann Leonard and I'm so excited to bring Ryann's Wines to East Meadow community! If you think my last name looks familiar, you’re right – I am part of the Stew Leonard's family! My grandpa, Stew Leonard Sr., opened the first Stew Leonard’s food store in 1969 in Norwalk, CT and my family still runs the business today. I grew up surrounded by family and farm fresh foods. What goes great with delicious, quality food? Wine, of course! That is why, I couldn’t be more excited to have Ryann’s Wines located right next door to Stew Leonard’s here in East Meadow! I hope you’ll find Ryann’s Wines to be an intimate and friendly local store offering a selection of products from around the world at great prices. Just like my family’s food business, at Ryann’s Wines, YOU are our #1 priority. I’m proud that Ryann’s Wines offers more than 30 wines from New York State, including local Long Island favorites such as Wolffer, Raphael and Paumonak. Share your passion for wine, beer, and spirits with me by following me on Instagram and Facebook @RyannsWines
  
  

Cashier -Wine Shop
  
Part Time Hourly – Estimated pay range $17 to $17.50 depending on qualifications and experience
  
Must be at least 18 years and older
  
  

**Position Description:**  

Scan items and take payment from customers, keeping the lines moving quickly, and helping customers with any questions or concerns. Ensuring accuracy at the register, and checking identification of customers ensuring the safe sale of alcoholic items.
  
  

**Your day-to-day:**  

* Welcoming customers and answering any questions they have about our products
* Balancing cash register
* Bagging items
* Generating the correct amount of change for customer
* Provide exceptional customer service
* counts money bag and is responsible for the contents
* understands the use of Vision computer system to look up products
* knows the stores exclusive and focus items
* collect email addresses
* keeps the store clean.
* Stocks register area
* Effectively uses down time to stock and clean
* Works toward basic wine and spirits knowledge
* Can tell the difference between wine items that may look similar


**What you bring to the team:**  

* Great work ethic
* Honest worker
* Flexible
* Great Customer Service
* Excellent Communication skills
* Willing to work in other departments as the business needs


**Working Conditions:**  

* Requires frequent walking, standing, reaching and bending, with occasional lifting up to 30 pounds
* Requires repetitive motion of arms and hands
* Potential exposure to hot and cold weather when operating cash register in outdoor seasonal shops


**Satisfy:**  

* Greet customers with a friendly smile and positive attitude, ensuring that each customer feels welcome and appreciated.


**Teamwork:**  

* Collaborate with team members to ensure the smooth operation of the store, offering assistance and support where needed.


**Excellence:**  

* Improve and maintain the efficiency of the store in order to reach success.


**Wow:**  

* Be a positive ambassador for the store, representing our S.T.E.W. values in all interactions with customers and team members. You are the biggest WOW!


Why you’ll love working here!
  
  

**Family Oriented:** We respect the personal balance between work and family with career opportunity and growth- over 80% of our managers have been promoted from within.
  
  

**Benefits:** High value, high quality Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, 401 K plan for FT & PT team members, family & personal time, life insurance, and more!
  
  

**Environment:** Have you seen the Avocado Girls? Chiquita Banana? Or the singing Parrot?

title: Homeless Prevention Housing Specialist
description:
**Essential Job Functions**

· Ensure compliance to regulations for all referrals;

· Participate in onboarding appointments for accepted participants.

· Manage assigned case load of accepted participants;

· Facilitate Case Management meetings at least monthly;

· Provide assistance with obtaining/maintaining any Federal, State, and local benefits and provision of SOAR benefits applications;

· Educate participants on their housing rights;

· Provide life skills training as needed in order to maintain permanent housing including money management and home maintenance;

· Transport residents to view apartments; advocate on resident’s behalf with prospective landlords; must use own personal vehicle when agency vehicle is unavailable;

· Provide or refer to support services designed to stabilize households in permanent, habitable housing;

· Facilitate program graduations.

· Coordinate all aspects of utility and rental arrears payments, rental assistance payments, and other eligible financial assistance.

· Complete 3-month income eligibility reviews for assigned case load.

· Research permanent housing opportunities and maintain housing resource database.

· Coordinate all aspects of participants movement to alternative housing;

· Complete habitability inspections;

· Coordinate lease signings;

· Execute Security Deposits and Repayment Agreements.

· Manage outstanding Security Deposit repayments including monthly invoicing and incoming payments.

· Provide aftercare services to graduates consisting of contact with participants at least monthly for six months following graduation from the program.

· Required to be ambulatory and present and able to perform all job functions without limitations, up to and including life preservation activities.

· Responsible to comply with all Agency Policies including Agency Code of Conduct and Confidentiality Policies, Medicaid Compliance Program and Protocols and Justice Center Code of Conduct.

· Maintain attendance and punctuality. Notify supervisor when late or absent. Provide adequate notice when scheduling time off.

**Job Duties include but are not limited to:**

· Orient, train and supervise assigned staff including preparation of staff evaluations and interviewing prospective candidates for staff positions.

· Attend and participate in staff meetings, training sessions and other relevant meetings as scheduled.

· Develop and maintain relationships with local realtors and landlords.

· Participate in HMIS reporting and SOAR certification.

· Report to Support Services Supervisor.

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

### **What you’ll be doing...**


As a full-time Verizon Retail Sales Associate, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career with a team focused on unlocking your full potential and sales success within one of our retail stores. Here's what you can expect:

* Generate retail sales by using your passion for cutting-edge technology, and exceptional customer service to expand the Verizon network.
* Learn and uncover customers' needs by creating connections and asking the right questions.
* Position product insights and solution recommendations to provide customers with a complete top-down sales solution.
* Close sales by using phenomenal communication skills to fulfill customer needs with simple and intuitive tech solutions.
* Continuously develop yourself through ongoing training and up-skill in operational functions across merchandising and inventory.
* Potential to grow your customer base by placing outbound calls and sending text messages to current Verizon customers who are interested in our products and services.
* Opportunities to engage with the community outside of the store to expand your loyal customer base, including at off-site Verizon sponsored events.


We’re hiring immediately and this isn't your average entry-level position! Whether you're early in your career or a seasoned sales professional, join today and earn from $49,000 to $59,000 a year, which includes base pay and target individual-based commission. Planning to go above and beyond? Our commission program allows unlimited opportunity which could allow top earners to make an extra $10,000 or more per year in addition to the compensation range quoted earlier. Compensation varies by geography and performance.


Our comprehensive benefits (starting day one) and perks are designed to help you move forward in your career and in your life outside of Verizon. From health and well-being benefits to investment in your education and career, we've got you covered!

* Best in class medical, dental, and vision
* Verizon 401(k) plan with matching contributions up to 6% of eligible participant contributions to the plan, qualified student loan repayments, or a combination of both (effective January 1, 2024)
* $2,500 stock grant per year, part of Verizon's Stock Together award program
* Sales recognition programs that have, in the past, awarded top performers with all inclusive travel to domestic and international destinations, gifts, and other incentives
* Five weeks of paid time off (vacation, holidays, personal days)
* 8 weeks of paid parental leave for eligible new parents (for new moms, when paired with short-term disability, this benefit provides up to 16 weeks of paid time-off)
* Up to $8K per year in tuition assistance
* Discounts up to 50% off on Verizon products and services
* Additional employee discounts on attractions, automotive, travel and more.


Too good to be true? Hear from our Verizon Retail Team Members on what it's like to be part of a team that invests in you. From our in-person new hire experience and award-winning training programs to our inclusive culture of learning and amazing benefits, you'll be able to apply your skills while elevating your career.

### **What we’re looking for...**


You’ll need to have:

* High school diploma or GED.
* One or more years of work experience.
* Willingness to work evenings, weekends, and holidays (you'll know your schedule four weeks in advance).
* Openness to pick up additional shifts and earn more income, typically during the summer months, November through December, and/or during peak vacation periods.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* Experience working in a commission-based environment.
* Demonstrated sales experience communicating with customers to find solutions.
* Customer service experience.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **After you apply…**


You may be required to take an assessment. It takes about 20 minutes to complete. If you’re selected to move forward, one of our recruiters will reach out to tell you more about the role and answer your questions.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this worksite-based role, you'll work onsite at a defined location(s).### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.


Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401(k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.
If you are hired into a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Maryland, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, Washington or Washington, D.C. work location, the starting base pay rate for this position is $19.71/hour. This is a commission based position with the potential to earn more.
company_description: Here, passion finds purpose and anyone who wants to make a difference can create impact. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

title: Care Coordinator/Front Desk -Penn Plaza
description:
Care Coordinator/Front Desk –Penn Plaza, Manhattan
  
Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is seeking a qualified, passionate Care Coordinator to join the team at our Penn Plaza clinic in Midtown, Manhattan.
  
Care Coordinators are responsible for supporting patient care by making our patients feel welcomed and valued whilst also controlling the flow of the appointment. Care Coordinators are expected to respond to all phone calls and emails within 2 hours and always within 24hours. Care Coordinators will guide our patients through our out-of-network experience and greet all patients who enter the clinic with a smile. Care Coordinators are expected to execute 5-star customer service. Spear strives to foster a true community environment for both patients and team members; therefore, a collaborative spirit is valued to ensure everyone receives the care and support they need.
  
  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Previous customer service experience.
* Someone who is hospitable, welcoming, and team-orientated.
* Strong communication skills and ability to multi-task.
* A strong attention to detail and willingness to grow.
* BA.BS degree preferred, not required.


**WHAT WE OFFER:**  

We know that exceptional patient service can only be achieved when our team is well cared for.
  
We strive to create an environment that bolsters career growth while providing the flexibility and
  
time necessary to simply be a human being. Further benefits include:
  
* One Medical paid membership. Learn more at onemedical.com/business
* Mental Health benefits that include paid time off and support services through Journey Live & employer sponsored EAP program.
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits, Commuter FSA Plan.
* 401(K) Safe Harbor Match: SPEAR will make a matching contribution equal to 100% of the first 3% of annual compensation, plus 50% of the next 2% of annual compensation. The total SPEAR matching contribution will not exceed 4% of your annual compensation
* Generous paid time including PTO, Floating Holidays, Company Holidays, Mental Health
* Commuter FSA Plans – pretax savings plans for travel to & from work
* Employee Perks: discounted rates for entertainment, travel, fitness, insurance plans, etc. Gym membership discounts with Blink & Crunch Fitness.
* Company Events - Annual Summer Picnic and Holiday Awards Celebration


**SALARY:** $16 - $22 / hr
  
  

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**  

We value empathy in our team members and a dedication to clinical excellence -- whatever your workstyle -- above all else. While we are looking for both entrepreneurial big-thinkers and those dedicated simply to the day-to-day of treatment, successful candidates will understand that being clear is kind and that actions express priorities. No matter where you are in your career, we are positive you will find your niche with us and grow.
  
  

**Further success factors may include:**  

* Passion for the field hospitality and customer service.
* Self-motivation and willingness to go above and beyond.
* Enjoyment of seeking out an opportunity to make an impact daily and connecting with people.
* A proactive, collaborative, team-oriented attitude because we don’t work in silos.
* You celebrate wins and learn from losses with your patients, colleagues, and surrounding communities.
* A resonance with our SPEAR-IT values:
* Service
* Passion
* Empathy
* Accountability
* Respect
* Impact
* Teamwork


**ABOUT US:**  

Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is the nation’s leading outpatient practice. With more than 40 clinics in the New York Tri-State Area and 25 years of experience, Spear provides unprecedented patient access to physical and occupational therapy through its robust list of services covered by most major insurances. Since its founding, Spear has been honored by some of the top medical, academic, and business communities. Among these accolades, they have twice been named the nation’s top physical therapy practice by the American Physical Therapy Association and WebPT, received the Columbia Award for Leadership in Clinical Education, served as official therapists to Olympic teams and Broadway shows, and been featured for their expertise in The New York Times, CBS News, Good Morning America, The Today Show, and more. Learn more about Spear’s history of excellence at spearcenter.com.
company_description: Every member of the Spear team is integral to the practice, and guided toward achieving his/her personal best.

title: Hospitality Manager
description:
Restaurant Associates  



**Position Title: Hospitality Manager**

**Pay 12**

**Reports To:**

**Salary: $65,000 - $70,000**

**Other Forms of Compensation:**

  

Become part of Restaurant Associates, the industry’s leading provider of dining and event catering for some of the nation's most prestigious museums, performing arts centers and corporations! **Voted Glassdoor's Employee Choice Awards**- *Best Places to Work in 2021,***This is R/A** **!**

**Job Summary**
---------------



Embark on a hospitality adventure as our ***Hospitality Ambassador***for the new premium lounge at JFK. In this role, you'll craft exceptional dining experiences and lead operations from the ground up. If you're a hospitality expert with a flair for innovation and eager to make your mark in our exciting new venture, join us in creating exceptional dining experiences.




As a ***Hospitality Ambassador***, you will play a crucial role in ensuring guests have an exceptional experience by maintaining high standards in service and facility management. Reporting directly to the General Manager, you will oversee daily operations, uphold superior food and beverage quality, and lead the team with excellent communication and multitasking skills.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Ensure guest satisfaction by maintaining high standards in service and facility management.
* Schedule, train, manage, and develop staff.
* Oversee budget and inventory management.
* Train and supervise staff in alcoholic beverage service.
* Assist with catering events related to shows.
* Maintain positive relationships with staff, venue clients, and the production team.
* Coordinate with managers to ensure appropriate staffing and attendance.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in managing teams and demonstrated strong communication skills.
* Excellent computer skills, self-motivation, planning skills, and the ability to make timely and competent decisions.
* Ability to manage large inventories and budgets.
* Flexibility to work business hours, including late afternoons, nights, and weekends.
* Quick problem-solving abilities and a desire to lead.
* Attention to detail while maintaining creativity.
* Knowledge of the hospitality business and market trends.
* College degree and management experience, particularly in the beverage industry, preferred.
* Certifications in service training, alcohol service, safe food handling, and first aid.
* Knowledge of state and local alcohol laws.
* Willingness to work an events-driven schedule.


As a Hospitality Ambassador, your focus will be on creating memorable experiences for guests, ensuring smooth operations, and leading a dedicated team to uphold the highest standards of service.




**Apply to Restaurant Associates today!**

*Restaurant Associates is a member of Compass Group USA*

**Click here to Learn More about the Compass Story**

We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with a criminal history (including relevant driving history), in a manner consistent with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York Fair Chance Act.**

title: Part Time Writer - Sports Betting & Gaming
description:
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are at the core of our mission to strengthen and empower the communities we serve.
  
  

Advance Local is looking for a Part-Time Writer to create event-driven and promotional content that supports initiatives around Sports Betting & iGaming as part of our growing business. This position will produce content specific to sports betting, casinos, sweepstakes, and lottery. The position will average approximately 20 hours per week; however, hours could vary depending on the time of the year (e.g., football season).
  
  

The pay rate for this position is $18 - $20 per hour.
  
  

Ideal candidates will have a strong understanding of SEO and a business mindset geared toward driving significant and sustainable revenue and audience through best journalistic practices.
  
  

We want a writer that is motivated and excited at the thought of growing a brand as well as expanding their journalistic skillset. You should be passionate and knowledgeable about all major sports and have a keen interest in online wagering. Reacting quickly to breaking sports news is part of the job, too. In addition to writing articles daily, this position involves some editing and daily role tracking of key metrics to ensure content is performing to goal.
  
  

We are looking for candidates that are highly competitive, detail-oriented and want to be part of an innovative team.
  
  

**You should apply if you have:**  

* Experience in sports writing and/or writing about online wagering
* Experience in commerce and affiliate marketing or revenue generating initiatives
* A passion for informing readers, building audiences, and generating revenue
* Familiarity with SEO best practices
* Clean copy and the confidence to self-edit
* A passion for digesting data and understanding audience metrics
* The ability to work independently and prioritize appropriately
* A competitive nature and mindset
* Strong organizational skills and poise to handle multiple tasks at once
* Ability to quickly pick up technology solutions
* Ability to work weekends, weeknights, and holidays when necessary


**Required education, experience, and skills:**  

* Degree in journalism, English or communications, or related field preferred, or a combination of equivalent education and experience
* Minimum 1 year of journalism experience with a proven ability in reporting and writing
* Some experience building, maintaining, and engaging an active audience
* Experience writing about sports and/or the online wagering industry
* Ability to work independently under deadline pressure and prioritize tasks appropriately
* Proven reporting, writing, and organizational skills
* Solid understanding of news writing, journalism ethics and story structure
* Experience with search engine optimization practices
* Experience using social media to source and promote content
* High proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Teams, and Slack
* Proficiency with content management platform Arc preferred
* Demonstrated capability in capitalizing on high-value topics by engaging audiences in frequency and urgency


Along with your resume, please include a cover letter with your application that details why you would be a good fit for this position as well as samples of your writing skills and/or links to relevant clips.
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
