title: Behavioral Health Consultant - BCBA
description:
Do you want to work for an organization that truly puts its employees first? If so Discovery ABA in (location) is the place for you. We are looking for a **full-time Behavioral Health Consultant - BCBA**


Our dynamic team provides a fulfilling position and competitive pay ranging between **$75.00- $85.00 an hour**. We also offer fantastic benefits such as:

* Accrued paid time off (PTO)
* Ongoing training opportunities
* BCBA internship program
* Cancellation compensation
* Growth and promotion within the company
* Bonus structures
* Comprehensive benefits package


Are you passionate about helping children? Apply today and let your passion shine!

 **WHAT SETS US APART**


Discovery ABA provides in-home, center-based, and school-based ABA therapy services to children aged 2 to 21. Our hands-on approach and commitment to evidence-based therapy aim to prepare children to function effectively in all areas of their lives. We are passionate about improving the lives of children with autism and empowering their families. With our great culture, we focus on providing the very best for both children and our staff. We pride ourselves on fostering a supportive and collaborative environment, offering fulfilling careers, amazing benefits, and endless opportunities for personal and professional growth!

 **WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR IN A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONSULTANT - BCBA**

* Master's degree
* Possess current BCBA certifications
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Fluency in practice management system (Central Reach preferred)
* Strong organizational and time management skills


Do you have what it takes? Keep reading to see if you'd love this role as our Behavioral Health Consultant - BCBA!

 **YOUR NEW ROLE AS OUR BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONSULTANT - BCBA**


This full-time Behavioral Health Consultant role is considered a **hybrid** position.


As a Behavioral Health Consultant - BCBA, you're at the helm of program coordination under our regional clinic director's guidance. Your day starts with assessments and treatment plan development, ensuring precise interventions for our clients. Building strong bonds with families, you steer future learning and independence, all while mentoring staff and RBTs to achieve top-notch clinical outcomes.


Collaboration with interdisciplinary team members is key for seamless care continuity. Your analytical edge is evident as you gather and graph behavioral data, driving assessments and interventions. Upholding agency policies and procedures, you embody our dedication to excellence and compassion in every interaction.


If you think this therapy job is what you are looking for, then applying is a snap. The initial application process should take you less than 3 minutes to complete. Good luck!

title: Buyer
description:
**Job Title: Buyer**

**Company: Owl Tree Kids**

**Location:** On-site at one of our two Brooklyn locations

**About Us:** Owl Tree Kids is a curated kids' clothing consignment store located in Brooklyn, New York. We offer a mix of vintage and luxury items alongside everyday, reliable basics. Our mission is to provide high-quality, stylish options for children while promoting sustainability through consignment.

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented part-time Buyer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be adept at managing consignor appointments, discerning saleable items based on taste and trend, and analyzing the condition and quality of pieces based on the filter set by **[Annie’s Role]** You will also be responsible for studying a running list of brands with low sell-through rates to inform purchasing decisions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Manage consignor appointments and maintain organized records
* Evaluate the condition and quality of items brought in by the consignor to ensure they meet our standards
* Analyze and accept consignor items based on; 1) sale-ability 2) style and aesthetic 3) It-Factor and 4) inventory statistics
* Provide exceptional customer service and support in a fast-paced, customer-facing environment

**Required Qualifications:**

* High taste level and passion for fashion
* Adaptability in a fast-paced retail environment
* Excellent customer service and communication skills
* Prior retail experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Current student studying fashion, design, or merchandising

**Benefits:**

* School credit for current students
* Product discount
* Flexible scheduling

**Application Process:** To apply, please send your resume and a cover letter detailing your interest in the position (short and sweet is fine!). We will review your application and, if we wish to proceed, we will schedule a Zoom meeting for further discussion.

**How to Apply:** Please send your application materials to annie@owltreekids.com with the subject line "Buyer Application - [Your Name]."

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Beverage Director
description:
**We are hiring a Beverage Director for Santi!**

Michael White, the renowned chef, restaurateur and innovator who helped define Manhattan’s modern Italian restaurant scene with destinations like Marea, Ai Fiori, and Osteria Morini, makes his return to New York with the October opening of Santi, from his BBianco Hospitality Group. Situated in the heart of midtown at Tishman Speyer’s 520 Madison Avenue, Santi will explore seasonal Italian cooking through the lens of White’s many years living in Italy and the South of France, offering both a culinary retrospective and an exciting next step in his storied career.

The name Santi is derived from a fond memory of White’s culinary mentor, Gianluigi Morini, a chef and bon vivant who helmed the kitchen at San Domenico. Eager to taste the dishes from the kitchen, he would wave off a plate and utensils and say: “Le mani degli chef sono come le mani dei santi” – “The hands of chefs are like the hands of saints.” At Santi, White’s menu retells the story of his years living and working in Imola, the Amalfi coast, and the South of France, with a menu consisting of handmade pastas, meats, fish, vegetables, crudos, rotating specials, and large format dishes. It builds on his 36 years in the kitchen and traverses the whole of the Italian peninsula with a focus on seasonality. There will be wild game, truffles, and ragouts in the fall, ephemeral green market produce in the spring, and rare ingredients from across the globe incorporated thoughtfully and with nuance.

The Beverage Director is responsible for ensuring the excellence, creativity, and profitability of Santi’s wine and spirits program. The position serves as a leader, educator, coach and mentor to the sommeliers, bartenders, and front of house line staff. The Beverage Director makes service, operations, scheduling and purchasing decisions that impact the financial health of the business and are responsible to do so in a way that is aligned with the culture and policies of Santi and BBianco Hospitality Group. The position combines management of people with staff education, creative input, and financial responsibility.

**Duties and Responsibilities** 

* Work with the Senior Leadership team to thoughtfully build Santi’s wine and cocktail program in a way that adds quality and value to the guest experience
* Work with the Senior Leadership team to ensure that all budgeted cost percentages are met each period
* Meet or exceed budget for beverage sales and beverage COGS
* Ensure accurate, efficient, cost effective and timely ordering of all items related to the wine, cocktail and overall beverage program
* Ensure that all end-of-period reports, inventories, and forecasts are completed accurately and on time, as directed by the Senior Leadership team
* Ensure that all POS systems, inventory systems, beverage lists, and any other information related to the wine program remain accurate and up to date
* Actively participate in service to promote, educate, and sell wine to guests
* Establish and foster strong relationships with beverage purveyors to ensure that our beverage programs receive the best product and pricing available and maintain a strong reputation as category leaders in the industry
* Manage the sommelier schedule in a way that ensures that the business has appropriate coverage to execute the highest level of service and hospitality during each shift, while considering all scheduling needs and costing
* Actively seek opportunities to connect with guests during service periods by being present on the floor
* Design and organize wine and spirit education programs and initiatives that assist the management team in educating the staff
* Lead well-planned and dynamic staff lineups before each shift to communicate important details of service and motivate staff to attain the highest level of job performance
* Provide continuous training and leadership to develop and grow all team members
* Spend time each day observing and coaching sommeliers in the technical elements of their jobs
* Complete other assignments and task as assigned by senior leadership
* Ensure that all staff are compliant with Company’s policies and procedures, as well as city, state, and federal laws

**Candidates can expect**:

* Competitive wages, above industry standard benefits, paid sick leave, and generous vacation time
* To be part of a growing team, and regularly engage together in cross-company dialogue and exchange
* A dedicated team of operators to support the venue and team

**Compensation and Benefits**

* $100,000 - $110,000 annually
* Health insurance
* Pre-tax transit benefits
* Paid Time Off

**Position Requirements:**

* Minimum 3+ years working in a fine dining restaurant or hotel environment as a beverage director, wine director or lead sommelier
* Beverage certifications in CMS, WSET, or similar organizations preferred
* Excellent knowledge of Italian wine, Italian spirits, and wine service
* General knowledge of food prep methods and culinary terminology
* Holds NY Department of Health and Mental Hygiene Food Protection Certificate

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to be flexible with job demands and open-minded when being asked to complete tasks
* Ability to operate and use all equipment necessary to run the restaurant
* Ability to handle stress under pressure
* Ability to move or handle equipment throughout the restaurant generally weighing 50 pounds
* Ability to work varied hours/days as business dictates
* Ability to stand for up to 8-10 hours a day

*BBianco Hospitality Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.  We do not discriminate on the basis race, color, creed, religion, gender (including gender identity and expression), sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth or related condition, sexual and reproductive health decisions, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, military or veteran status, genetic information or predisposing genetic characteristic, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual violence, or stalking, or any other legally protected status.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Night shift

Experience:

* beverage director: 3 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* CMS (Required)
* WSET (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales Rep/Receptionist
description:

title: Dental Assistant
description:
### **Join the future of dentistry, led by dentists**



At Dental365, we're reshaping the way patients experience dental care. By placing patients and providers at the core of our approach, we're breaking new ground in the world of dentistry. Since our inception in 2014, we've touched the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients and have emerged as a leading and distinguished dental organization, led by dentists. If you're a motivated change-maker looking to build a lifelong career in dentistry – now is the time to take part in our journey.


**Dental assisting is about crafting confident smiles, building your skills and delivering compassionate care for our patients.**


### **OUR PRACTICE:**


**Dental365 - Esposito Dental**
990 Franklin Avenue, Garden City, NY 11530
### **HIRING SCHEDULE:**


* Sunday: OFF
* Monday: 9:00am - 5:00pm
* Tuesday: OFF
* Wednesday: 10:00am - 7:00pm
* Thursday: 9:00am - 6:00pm
* Friday: OFF
* Saturday: 8:00am - 2:00pm

### **RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Welcoming patients with a smile, making them feel comfortable and confident throughout their visit.
* Support the Dentist with various procedures.
* Taking digital radiographs and intra-oral scans as prescribed
* Ensure strict infection control by meticulously preparing and sterilizing instruments and equipment.
* Sanitizing and prepping operatories for respective treatments.
* Adhere to OSHA and safety policies, prioritizing a secure and healthy environment.
* Educate patients on effective oral hygiene strategies as needed
* Undertake diverse office tasks as needed for seamless practice operations.

### **QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Prior dental assisting experience required.
* Any certification/license as required by the state to perform specified duties.
* A resume showcasing a consistent and stable employment history.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills, delivering exceptional patient experiences.

### **OUR BENEFITS:**


* **Generous Compensation:** We invest in the best and are competitive in our salary offers.
* **Flexible Health and Vision Insurance Plans**: Tailored options for you and your family's well-being.
* **401(K) Retirement Plan with Matching:** Secure your financial future with our employer-matched plan up to 6%.
* **Generous Paid-Time Off:** Accrue up to 3 weeks, plus an annual "you" day for self-care.
* **Exclusive In-house Dental Program**: Heavily discounted services for you and your immediate family.
* **Fresh Scrubs:** Accrue an annual scrub allowance through our uniform partners.
* **Extra Perks and Fringe Benefits:** Enjoy additional benefits and ongoing perks for our dedicated teams.


* *All benefits available at full-time employment (30+ hours weekly). Some benefits available for part-time employees as well.*



New York Salary Range: $17/HR - $24/HR


### **Step into a new era with Dental365**


**A modern practice environment designed for superior care and comfort.** We embrace cutting-edge technology in a soothing environment that goes beyond your ordinary dental practice. We've thought through every step in the patient's experience to perfect our communication and care so that each visit is an eagerly anticipated event.


**We're a team that supports your success.** Emphasizing health over sales, we cultivate a warm, supportive culture without the pressure of production quotas. Those motivated for growth in their career are encouraged and supported to reach their full potential.


**Premier Care Dental Management** **celebrates diversity.** Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression in terms of all conditions of employment. Our diversity is one of our greatest strengths, and as an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to promote a work environment where all differences are respected.

title: Foster Care Associate-Canine & Feline experience/knowledge
description:
North Shore Animal League America is the largest no-kill animal rescue and adoption organization in the world. We are a non-profit organization and since 1944, the League's mission has been saving the lives of pets through adoption, rescue and advocacy initiatives. Every year, the League reaches across the country to rescue, nurture and adopt nearly 18,000 pets into happy and loving homes. Over the years, the League has placed more than 1.1 million puppies, kittens, cats and dogs into carefully screened homes.

We are seeking a full time 40 hours per week 5 days a week including 1 weekends day Foster Care Associate that will be responsible for assisting with the daily operations of the Foster Care Department and supporting the Volunteer Department as needed on a weekly basis with administrative tasks, events, and inventory. The Foster Care Associate will provide support to the Foster Care Manager so that they can continue to cultivate relationships with the foster parents, implement new ideas to increase foster homes, as well as place foster animals directly into adoptive families utilizing both social media and offsite events.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* · Updating and maintaining program spreadsheets and databases
* · Reviewing and accepting applications
* · Assist in conducting foster parent interviews
* · Assist with Foster Parent Orientations
* · Returning phone calls and emails
* · Coordinating supply pickups
* · Admitting/Discharging foster animals
* · Help process adoptions of foster animals and PTA’s
* · Attend necessary medical appointments for follow up when available
* · Follow up on test results, diagnostic plans, etc. with Veterinarians
* Handle introductions of Foster Pets to Foster Parent and other animals in the house
* · Maintaining inventory
* · Updating the department calendar
* · Assisting with department newsletter & social media as needed
* · Actively communicating with foster care parents on a weekly basis
* · Other duties as assigned.

**Requirements:**

* · Qualified candidates must love animals and have the ability to handle animals safely and with patience and possess a basic knowledge of animal welfare.
* · Must be very well organized, detail oriented with excellent follow-up skills and the ability to multi-task, prioritize & manage time effectively while executing multiple projects successfully.
* · Proficient in Excel, Word, and Power Point.
* · Excellent Administrative skills such as scanning, filing, data entry and photocopying.
* · Strong phone contact handling skills and active listening
* · Animal handling skills are a must! This includes canines and felines, and all sizes of animals.
* · Should possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills and have a positive and professional attitude.
* · Must be able to work cooperatively with a varied group of volunteers and employees in a fast-paced environment.
* · The ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* · Able to lift up to 40lbs. and carry shelter supplies.
* · Must maintain a valid and clean NY State Driver’s license.
* · Must be able to work a flexible schedule that includes evenings and one weekend day per week. Must be able to work holidays as needed.
* · A passion for animal rescue and a desire to be a part of NSALA’s process of rescue, nurture, adopt and educate.
* · Desired but not required skills include knowledge of shelter operations, animal health & behavior.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $17.50 per hour

title: HR Associate
description:
Started in 2016, FreedomCare is a Healthcare company that is innovating and revolutionizing the way home care is delivered. We bring dignity and support to patients needing care in their homes and to the caregivers who care for them. We're the largest consumer-directed home care agency in NY State, and are continually expanding our areas of focus including operations in other states and tech-based innovations.



We pride ourselves on our values which drive the level of care that we deliver to our patients:


* Here For You (An attitude of service, empathy, and availability)
* Own It (Drive and ownership)
* Do the Right Thing (High integrity)
* Be Positive (Great attitude and a can-do positive approach to challenges)


Join our team and make a positive impact on the lives of others! We are looking for an HR Associatefor our People & Culture team.


*This is a hybrid role that requires a partial commute into our main office in New York or the FreedomCare hub closest to you.*


**Department & Position Overview:**



The HR Associate will be an intricate part of the People Business Partner team at FreedomCare. This role will support and learn many aspects of the People Business Partner/HR/ER work while collaborating to drive processes and support a great culture as we continue to grow and evolve.


**Everyday You Will:**



This role will touch all aspects of administrative support for the People Business Partners, helping to drive timely, effective HR collaboration and a positive work environment. Including the following, but not limited to:


* Own the maintenance of our electronic employee files
* Conduct exit interviews and package highlights
* Support activities during merit and promotions cycles as needed
* Manage and prepare and send offboarding emails
* Provide follow-up on issues and provide outreach to internal client groups as needed
* Prepare drafts of severance/separation agreements
* Coordinate documentation for immigration needs
* Initiate updates on the People Business Partner SharePoint sites
* Schedule meetings with internal stakeholders
* Work on various projects


**Ideal Candidate Will Possess:**


* Minimum 2-4 years' experience working in a Human Resources function; minimum 5 years of total work experience
* Bachelor's degree preferred
* Solid working experience anticipating next steps and taking initiative to get work done.
* Solid working or advanced knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint and Canva a plus
* Possess a working knowledge and understanding of HR practices
* Must be highly organized to give proper attention to all items that require attention
* Must be flexibility with the ability to switch gears based on business need
* Ability to take initiative and follow through after initial delegation
* Ability to prioritize conflicting deliverables
* Must be able to clearly communicate (live, virtually and in writing) to a wide variety of groups
* Ability to be proactive on process flow and work to desired outcomes
* Curious, humble, excited to learn and contribute in a team environment
* Incredibly detail-oriented; able to input data accurately and track all tasks to completion
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


 **Why work at FreedomCare?**



We are here for you and committed to providing a best-in-class employee experience. We offer competitive compensation, medical benefits, retirement plans, wellness programs, fun company events and ongoing learning opportunities to grow your career.



This is a place where your voice matters, where we build great relationships, and your work has meaning and a tangible positive impact on others!


*At FreedomCare, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, citizenship or immigration status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.*

title: Strategy and Operations Manager
description:
**Who We Are:**



Click Therapeutics, Inc., develops, validates, and commercializes software as prescription medical treatments for people with unmet medical needs. As a leading innovator of Digital Therapeutics™, Click delivers accessible, clinically proven, FDA-regulated prescription treatments to the smartphone in your hand. Click's treatments are defined by a commitment to applying technical and scientific rigor and patient-centric design to the development process. This results in uniquely engaging experiences that achieve compelling clinical outcomes for patients seeking new treatment options. Click Therapeutics continuously expands and refines its platform with novel cognitive, behavioral and neuromodulatory mechanisms of action and advanced data-driven tools such as artificial intelligence and machine learning. The digital therapeutics under development on Click's platform address diverse areas of therapeutic need, including indications in psychiatry, neurology, oncology, immunology, and cardiometabolic diseases. Consistently named a best place to work, Click fosters an inclusive, diverse workforce of innovators, clinicians, scientists, researchers, designers, technologists, engineers and more, united in a common mission to provide patients everywhere access to safe and effective prescription digital therapeutics. For more information, visit www.clicktherapeutics.com and connect with us on LinkedIn.


**About the Role:**



As the Strategy and Operations Manager you will work directly with Click's Director of Strategy to manage and execute on strategic planning, strategic execution, and strategic initiatives for the company. You will support the development of our overall company strategy and corporate objectives, update them in response to emerging information and communicate them throughout the organization. This is a highly cross-functional role that works across all departments to integrate strategic needs, opportunities, and inputs; and ensure ongoing alignment between tactical execution and strategic goals. As part of this role, you will also manage activities that enable key strategic initiatives and support cross functional execution. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, are success-orientated, and you can work independently to prioritize and achieve key goals, you may be the right candidate to join our team.



This position is based out of Click's headquarters located in Tribeca, NYC, at the center of one of the fastest-growing digital health communities. We have a hybrid working model that consists of at least 3 days in office each week.


**Responsibilities:**


* Partner with the Director of Strategy to drive key strategic initiatives that will advance the success of Click, its portfolio, and the digital therapeutics industry. These initiatives span all functions, with a special focus on business development, corporate development, public policy, and communications.
* Design and execute strategic assessments to inform and drive company's strategic focus, business objectives, and organizational priorities.
* Support resource planning and management that enables all internal activities under the direction of the Strategic Execution Team leads.
* Drive the development of market building strategy and build collaterals enable the Business Development, Policy, Investor Relations and the Communications team.
* Partner with cross-functional leaders to author, articulate, and drive continuous improvement of their strategy to enable Click's progress towards its mission and vision.
* Drive operational excellence of Click's Strategy function through annual planning and tracking of key activities.


**Qualifications:**


* 8+ years of experience as an individual contributor in Corporate Strategy, Portfolio Strategy, New Product Planning, Business Development, or Management Consulting with a focus on the life sciences industry or equivalent.
* 5+ years of experience with 2+ years as a people manager.
* Must have superb organizational and time management skills, and excellent attention to detail.
* Must have an analytical mindset and strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally and navigate different team dynamics.
* Highly adaptable to a dynamic atmosphere of changing requirements and scope.
* Able to correspond with internal and external contacts in a professional manner.
* Superb writing, visual design, and communication skills.
* A graduate of a 4-year degree from a top-tier university with strong academic track record.
* Ability to anticipate potential needs and challenges before they occur.


**Preferred Qualification:**


* Direct prior experience in the prescription digital therapeutics industry with fluency in one or more of key domains relevant to the industry (commercial, finance, operations, etc.).


**Compensation:**



The base salary range for this position is between: $158,500 - 175,000. The final base salary will be dependent upon skills, experience and location. In addition to the base salary, Click Therapeutics offers an annual performance-based cash bonus and a generous equity package.


**Benefits:**



The role includes great benefits and is an excellent wealth-building opportunity at a fast-growing pre-IPO company in a nascent and extremely exciting space.



Competitive Salary with Annual Review | Cash Bonus | Stock Options | 5% 401(k) matching | Medical | Dental | Vision | Life Insurance | Voluntary Benefits | Unlimited PTO | Uber One | Nectar Rewards | One Medical | Fertility Support | Fitness Reimbursement | Bike Membership | Professional Development Stipend | Lunch Stipends | Parent Benefits | LinkedIn Learning | Gemini Enterprise Stack | Industrious Workspaces | Commuter Subsidies | Flexible Work Arrangement | Choice of Mac or Windows | Sponsored Company Events | Office Snacks and Beverages | Much More…


**Equal Employment Opportunity:**



Click Therapeutics is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Click Therapeutics also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act. All applicants must have authorization to work for Click Therapeutics in the U.S. In certain circumstances it may be advantageous to Click Therapeutics to support the application(s) for temporary visa classification and/or sponsor applications for permanent residence so that a foreign national colleague can accept or remain in a work assignment in the U. S. For certain classes of temporary visas, the resulting work authorization may be specific to Click Therapeutics and the specific job and/or work site. Click Therapeutics may at its business discretion decide to or refrain from obtaining, maintaining and/or extending the temporary visa status and/or sponsoring a colleague for permanent residency and /or employment eligibility, considering factors such as availability of qualified U.S. workers and the colleague's long-term prospects for securing lawful permanent residence, among other reasons. Employment applicants requiring immigration sponsorship must disclose, when initial application for employment is made, whether or not they are legally authorized to work for Click Therapeutics in the U.S. and, if so, whether that authorization permits them to work in the job they seek. In no case should Click Therapeutics support of a colleague's temporary visa application or sponsorship of a colleague for permanent residence be construed to guarantee success of that application or amend or otherwise invalidate the "at-will" employment relationship between the colleague and Click Therapeutics.


**Recruitment Phishing Scams:**



Fake job advertisements and offers are increasingly appearing on the internet. If you have encountered a job posting or have been approached with a job offer that you suspect may be fraudulent, we strongly recommend you do not respond and report it to the Federal Trade Commission and the FBI at https://www.ic3.gov/Home/ComplaintChoice.You can also contact our team at recruitment@clicktherapeutics.com to report details of your experience.



Please be mindful of the following:


* Click Therapeutics will only reach out to you through an "@clicktherapeutics.com" email address.
* Other than your email address or telephone number, which you may provide via a job application portal, Click Therapeutics will never ask you to provide personally identifiable information about yourself (such as a Social Security Number or Driver's License Number) via a messaging application (like that used on the LinkedIn platform or Microsoft Teams).
* Click Therapeutics will conduct interviews face-to-face over Zoom.
* All job postings will be listed on the Click Therapeutics official career page. If someone contacts you about a job or position that is not listed on the official career page, please contact the Click Therapeutics recruitment team at the contact information below.


If you have any questions regarding the validity of a recruitment inquiry or an interview, please contact the Click's recruitment team at recruitment@clicktherapeutics.com to confirm before proceeding.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a Front Desk Receptionist (English and Spanish Speaking) to work in our Medical Office. The ideal candidate will be the first point of contact for our organization, providing exceptional customer service and administrative support.

Duties

- Greet and welcome guests in a friendly and professional manner

- Answer phone calls, take messages, and redirect calls as necessary

- Excellent time management and multitasking abilities

Join our team as a Front Desk Receptionist to contribute to a welcoming environment and efficient office operations.

title: Retail part time key holder
description:
Floor Supervisor/Keyholder Job Description

Summary: Floor Supervisor/Keyholder is an entry-level management position. A Floor Supervisor/Keyholder shares in

the responsibility for the overall performance of the store and assists Store Management with generating sales

potential, recruiting and developing staff, maintaining store appearance, controlling expenses and shortages.

Overall Responsibilities

 Proactively search for ways to maximize sales volume

 Maintain visual presentation standards that are consistent with company philosophy and direction

 Demonstrate effective written and verbal communication skills

 Proficient in all operational policies and procedures

 Manage time and prioritize tasks

 Assume leadership role with Sales Associates

 Timely completion of all tasks assigned or delegated by supervisor

Customer Service/Sales

 Ensure customer service is the #1 priority

 Effectively supervise the sales floor to ensure customer/associate awareness at all times

 Daily implementation of the S.P.O.R.T. customer service program

 Follow all customer service expectations as outlined in the Service Audit

Leadership

 Motivate and develop associates to meet store goals/objectives

 Clearly delegate activities and follow-up on all direction

 Demonstrate teamwork within store and company

 Take initiative and use sound judgment

 Lead by example

Personnel

 Demonstrate professional image and conduct

 Follow specific company dress code policy

 Ensure that store staff is treated professionally, courteously and respectfully

 Involve and develop store staff in accomplishing store goals

 Take an active role in own development

 Communicate staff concerns to management

 Support all company/management decisions

 Utilize all training programs/materials effectively

Operations

 Execute and follow-up on all operational policies, procedures and directives which are listed but not limited to

Google docs, LPI audit, Associate Handbook, Service audit, and the Policy & Procedure manual

 Have working knowledge of the Shrink Awareness Guide

 Execute and follow-up on all loss prevention counter measures to include but not limited to shrink derived from

paperwork errors, internal theft, and external theft

 Ensure accuracy in all paperwork with an emphasis in timely distribution to the appropriate person

Rev. 8/13

Visual Presentation

 Maintain store appearance to reflect USPA standards

 Execute and maintain company marketing directives

 React to sell through and ensure store is well stocked

 Ensure price change set-up is timely and effective

 Execute markdowns and re-merchandise as needed

 Have knowledge of the store merchandise

 Have knowledge of sales floor and stockroom organization

 Keep management informed of all merchandise-related issues

Expected hours: 15 – 29 per week

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

* Day shift
* Evening shift

title: Intelligence Analyst
description:
Move forward with us! At NJ TRANSIT, you'll join us in transforming the third-largest transportation agency in North America. We are committed to delivering safe, reliable service that gets our customers to their destinations on time—and we’re looking to hire talented folks with a love of learning to make it all possible. **PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBLITIES:*** Conduct intelligence analysis on criminal and terrorism threats, and provide written operational and strategic products for internal Police Department use. Coordinate with local, state and federal entities in the production of joint intelligence products.
* Supports the Comparative Statistics (COMPSTAT) Program by utilizing a statistical methodology focusing on geospatial and temporal patterns and preparing regular reports for the NJ TRANSIT Police Command Staff.
* Provide tactical case investigative support through the analysis of available information and data to support NJ TRANSIT Police operations.
* Support the Director of Intelligence and Intelligence Unit staff in preparing and presenting terrorism and criminal intelligence briefings to Police Department Staff, NJ TRANSIT personnel and law enforcement partners.
* Support police operations and investigations by processing information and data requests, including video feeds, crime data and other related information requests.
* Performs other tasks that may be asked or directed by Deputy or Chief of Police.

 **KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS REQUIRED:*** Bachelors degree in Criminal Justice, International Relations, Political Science or related area.
* Master’s Degree or two years of experience with law enforcement intelligence or military / national intelligence preferred.
* Successful completion of Federal IATP (Intelligence Analyst Training Program) or similar training to ensure proficiency in intelligence analysis and production desired.
* Experience with Police COMPSTAT programs desired.
* Must be proficient in data entry/formatting, database management and Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel and PowerPoint as well as demonstrated organizational, records management, research, problem solving, communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills.
* Must be able to pass a police background investigation.
* Must be able to obtain secret clearance from the federal government.
* Must be available to work when needed during but not limited to emergencies, weekends and holidays.
* Some traveling may be needed.

**Preferred:**
Experience with Police COMPSTAT programs desired. **Essential:**
 Proficiency in data entry/formatting, database management and Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel and PowerPoint as well as demonstrated organizational, records management, research, problem solving, communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills required. **At NJ Transit, you will enjoy a competitive salary and excellent benefits package:*** Comprehensive Family Health Insurance – Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision
* Flexible Spending Account
* Life Insurance
* Paid Leave
* Tuition Assistance
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Plan
* Retirement Plans
	+ 401(a) - Retirement plan with a 6% employer contribution
	+ 401(k) - Retirement saving plan with up to an 3% company match
	+ 457(b) - Deferred Savings Plan

**At NJ TRANSIT, diversity and inclusivity are vital to our success as are committed to hiring individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and veteran status. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we encourage all qualified applicants to apply and join our team.**  

﻿INDCO1

title: Front End Engineer - Assistant Vice President
description:
iCapital is powering the world's alternative investment marketplace. Our financial technology platform has transformed how advisors, wealth management firms, asset managers, and banks evaluate and recommend bespoke public and private market strategies for their high-net-worth clients. iCapital services approximately $187 billion in global client assets invested in 1,504 funds, as of April 2024.

  



iCapital has been named to the Forbes Fintech 50 for seven consecutive years (2018-2024); a three-time selection by Forbes to its list of Best Startup Employers (2021-2023); and a three-time winner of MMI/Barron's Solutions Provider award (See link below).

  


**About the Role**



iCapital is looking to hire a Frontend Engineer to join the Platform Engineering team. This role will work on building the frontend of our platform in ReactJS. This work may be in support of new feature development, defect resolution, or UX enhancements as prioritized by the business. The ideal candidate will work closely with our Product Management and UX Design teams throughout the software development process, detailing requirements, reviewing work in progress, and addressing issues found via manual test efforts. The role will need to pay close attention to consistency and detail in implementation of design and UX specifications, along with functional requirements. The candidate will work with other team leads to define our frontend strategy as we foray into micro-frontend based architecture. The role may also offer the ability to manage a small team.

  


**Responsibilities**


* Build application features and reusable UI components in React 18+
* Write unit and integration tests, using Jest and React Testing Library
* Use modern frontend state management technologies like React Query, Redux, and hooks
* Active participation in recurring stand-up meetings, refinement, and retrospectives
* Participate in thorough Peer Code Reviews as part of our standard SDLC and Change Management Process
* Contribute to development of internal standards for frontend code style and code quality, and model them for the team
* Contribute to development of testing best practices, and model them for the team
* Participate in or lead design/architecture discussions about forward-looking technology strategy

  


**Qualifications**


* 5+ years of development experience with JS frameworks such as React, Vue, or Angular, with 10+ years total progressive experience
* 5+ years of HTML / CSS development
* 5+ years of experience with web development ecosystem and working with backend REST / GraphQL APIs
* 4+ years of experience with JavaScript state management tools (React Query, Redux, Mobx, etc.)
* 4+ years of experience with JavaScript build tools (Webpack, Vite, Grunt, etc.) · 2+ years of experience working with Typescript or other strongly-typed programming language · 2+ years of experience directly managing other software engineers
* Experience working with micro-frontends is a plus
* Four-year college degree, preferably in Computer Science or a Math/Engineering discipline
* Keen eye for technical implementation of design and user experience elements
* Opinionated view on CSS structure within the context of a large application
* Demonstrated experience with advanced CSS implementations
* Able to work in an Agile / Kanban methodology
* Able to work independently or as part of a group effort, as required
* Excellent problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication skills
* Collaborative approach to software development

  


**Benefits**



The base salary range for this role is $120,000 to $160,000. iCapital offers a compensation package which includes salary, equity for all full-time employees, and an annual performance bonus. Employees also receive a comprehensive benefits package that includes an employer matched retirement plan, generously subsidized healthcare with 100% employer paid dental, vision, telemedicine, and virtual mental health counseling, parental leave, and unlimited paid time off (PTO).



We believe the best ideas and innovation happen when we are together. Employees in this role will work in the office three days, with the flexibility to work remotely two days. Every department has different needs, and some positions will be designated in-office jobs, based on their function.



For additional information on iCapital, please visit https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us Twitter: @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc | Awards Disclaimer: https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us/recognition/

  



iCapital is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

description:

title: Installation Sales
description:
**Ring's End, Inc.** is seeking a determined **full-time** **Installation Services Sales Representative**. This position earns a **competitive pay** and is eligible for **great benefits**, including traditional and Roth 401K, 3% 401K safe harbor company contribution, various medical insurance plans, FSA & DCA, employee discounts on our products and materials, life/accidental death & dismemberment insurance, long & short-term disability, paid holidays, paid time off (PTO), employee assistance program, and a legal counseling program. If this opportunity sounds like the right job for you, **keep reading**!

 **ABOUT RING'S END INC**


We are a Connecticut-based lumber and building materials retailer serving Connecticut, South County, Rhode Island, and Westchester County, New York. We are a third-generation, family-run company with a rich history dating back to 1902. Guided by a tradition of service and a commitment to innovation, we are dedicated to becoming the premier resource in the building material industry for builders and remodelers, painting contractors, architects, and homeowners.


Our growth and success are due to our team of professionals. We employ the best team in the industry, ensuring we maintain a **diverse** and **evolving** work environment that values **cooperation and teamwork**. We look for innovation and continuous improvement in everything we do. We're looking for more to join us!

 **DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN INSTALLATION SERVICES SALES REPRESENTATIVE**


The incumbent will sell and promote Installation Services with a responsibility for making sales throughout the company. The incumbent will develop and maintain a close and continuing relationship with all customers including homeowners & builders within the Company's market area. Train Ring's End Sales Associates to sell and promote Installation Services at all locations.


Informs customer about the quality of doors, windows, and other related materials. Interface with Sales and Management to provide our customers with timely installation of windows, doors and other related materials. Receive telephone calls from customers answering questions about products, inventory, timeframes and all related information.

 **WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU**


The incumbent must be flexible and adaptable to the changes that rapidly affect this position. Sales positions require exceptional customer service and problem-solving skills. Product knowledge is critical as well as awareness to inventory levels. Ability to work on a computer register and operate keyboard. Answer telephones and respond to customers' needs. Need to perform mathematical functions.

 **Duties Include but not limited to:**

* Prospect for new business
* Follow through on sales leads quickly and efficiently
* Assist customers to effectively present product offerings in the necessary environment (their home, showrooms, etc.)
* Articulate installation and scheduling procedures
* Prepare quotes and discuss credit terms
* Obtain accurate measurements at job sites prior to order and obtains project details and photographs of project details as necessary and communicates with Installed Sales Manager and Installation teams
* Evaluate site conditions and looks to pre-determine if there are building issues (i.e. water damage and rot) that must be addressed in order to properly install new product
* Review orders for accuracy and delivers to Installation Coordinator ordering
* In some cases, deliver orders to Manager for recommendation and approval
* Take initial deposit or initialize homeowner financing options
* Keep open communication with and maintain strong working relationships with Installation team
* Sell the maximum output of allotted products at authorized prices, and in accordance with established merchandising plans and policies
* Correspond with regular customer contacts and potential customers promoting the sale of Ring's End products
* Instruct customers on use of products
* Handle instances of consumer dissatisfaction and specific customer complaints fairly, promptly, and effectively, and recommend adjustments to management
* Cooperate with the credit department in obtaining customer credit information and aid in collecting delinquent accounts
* Provide feedback to marketing/purchasing concerning the market needs for new improved products and services, changes in competitive policies, and strategies relating to products and markets, channels of distribution, advertising and promotion, pricing and sales activity
* Assist in evaluating the effectiveness of advertising programs and sales aids

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
Xactly Restoration Recruiters has an elite client seeking an experienced Regional Sales Manager in the New York City area to join their team!

We are North America's Largest Restoration Industry Recruiting Agency. Our Services are always confidential and of no cost to you! We only Place "A" Players for our clients and that is why we are interested in you!

The Regional Sales Manager is responsible for driving the Company's marketing campaigns, overseeing the client database, and maintaining an active presence at local and regional associations and trade show events. You will be responsible for growing business profits and revenue and developing long-standing business relationships.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Understand the competitive advantages of using our Company and gain the ability to effectively educate clients and customers about brand benefits.
* Prepare a business development plan based on past performance and franchise growth objectives to meet and/or exceed planned revenue and activities goals for the business development team.
* Build, maintain, and strengthen client relationships with contacts in our sales territory and seek to develop new prospects and leads to ensure revenue growth.
* Complete annual marketing needs assessment, including planning the number of CE classes, lunch-and-learns, scheduling the budget, and developing action plans for business decision makers.
* Perform a comparative analysis of revenue, collection, and activities metrics vs established goals.
* Develop marketing initiatives and budget to create an annual marketing plan.
* Recruit, train, develop, and manage marketing teammates.

**Position Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business or equivalent experience preferred.
* At least 5 years B2B (face-to-face) Sales Management experience.
* Experience in building a strong team with tangible leadership skills.
* Sales within the intangible service sector preferred.
* Strong process and results driven attitude.

**Salary** $120,000 to $150,000 plus bonus.

**Benefits**

* Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance Available.
* 401(k)
* Paid Time Off.

**About Xactly Restoration Recruiters byGTE:**

We at Xactly byGTE have a laser-like focus on finding and placing talent for companies in the mitigation and restoration industry. Our mission is finding great talent for great companies. Please visit XactlybyGTE.com for more information.

Xactly byGTE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to employing a diverse workforce, including, but not limited to, minorities, females, individuals with disabilities, protected veterans, sexual orientation, gender identity. Equal Employment Opportunity is The Law.

title: Associate Veterinarian
description:
**Small Animal Associate Veterinarian** 

Are you an Associate Veterinarian seeking a rewarding opportunity to make a meaningful impact? Look no further! As a privately owned and **multi-doctor practice** nestled in the heart of Teaneck, NJ, just **a stone's throw away from vibrant New York City**, we're committed to providing the highest quality of care for our team and exceeding client expectations. At **Bergen Veterinary Hospital**, everything we do revolves around empowering our team members to achieve their personal and professional goals. Join us at Bergen Veterinary Hospital and be part of a community where your passion for veterinary medicine is not only valued but also cultivated to its fullest potential.

* **Mentorship Magic:** As the President of the Northern New Jersey Veterinary Medical Association, Dr. Suss has a passion for teaching and supporting new graduates and seasoned veterinarians to pursue their career goals. Dr. Suss’s reliable mentorship is provided in tandem with the support of a Blue Heron Consulting Medical Coach to ensure you receive the personalized guidance you need to thrive in your role.
* **Championing Quality:** We don't just practice medicine; we practice excellence. With an array of cutting-edge diagnostic equipment including laser therapy, ultrasound units, digital whole body and dental x-rays, echocardiograms, an orthopedic and soft tissue boarded surgeon, a board-certified radiologist, along with cryosurgery capabilities. We provide you with the tools you need to practice top-tier veterinary medicine! Candidates with an interest in providing services for pocket pets, avian, and exotics are a plus, but not required!
* **Culture Club:** But perhaps the greatest benefit of working at BVH is the sense of camaraderie and collaboration that permeates our practice. Our team of five doctors enjoy working together and learning from one another, creating a respectful work environment where everyone feels valued and supported. From celebrating your achievements, making weekend shifts optional, and providing you with the necessary tools and encouragement for growth, we're dedicated to nurturing a supportive and enriching environment where you can thrive.

**Compensation & Benefits** 

* $150,000 prosal paid on 20% production - no negative accrual
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance offered
* $2,000 CE stipend + 4 CE days
* 120 PTO hours per year + paid holidays
* No weekend or on-call responsibilities
* Short-term disability insurance offered through New Jersey
* 401k with 4% employer match
* Coaching provided in partnership with Blue Heron Consulting Medical Coaching
* Dues and license allowance covered (NJ Vet license, NJ CDS License, PLIT, VIN, NNJVMA dues).
* Pet employee discounts

**Teaneck, New Jersey** 

Conveniently located just a 10-minute drive from the iconic George Washington Bridge, our community provides easy access to the bustling excitement of New York City. But that's not all—Teaneck boasts a prime location surrounded by natural beauty, with majestic mountains, serene lakes, and sandy beaches all within a short driving distance. Whether you're craving an outdoor adventure or a day of urban exploration, Teaneck offers endless possibilities for leisure and recreation.

title: WAREHOUSEMAN - Order Picker
description:
**Selector - Order Picker**


$18 - $30++ per hour Permanent Shift: Sunday-Thursday 1:00pm until finish

**Responsibilities:**

* Selecting full case grocery and dairy products from warehouse pick slots using pallet jacks.
* Product selection is directed using audio headsets then stacking product on pallets and labeling each case.
* When pallet is complete, product is then wrapped in plastic wrap and moved to correct dock location to be loaded on truck

**Benefits:**

* 401K Company match up to 5%
* $18 hour Permanent Shift (with $2 per hour summer & fall shift differential) & Regular Overtime at $27 hour
* Plus production incentive program based on performance
* Paid 2 week training period
* Paid Sick, Personal and Vacation Days
* Full Medical
* Dental & Vision

**Requirements:**

* Location:Carlstadt, New Jersey (Meadowlands area)
* **$16 Training** ***2 week*** ***period*****: Sunday - Thursday 1:00pm - 9:30pm**
* Pre-shift safety check on equipment.
* Work in multi-temperature environment
* Meet weekly productivity standards and accuracy.
* Constant standing, walking, bending and continuously lifting up to 60 pounds.
* Must be able to read alpha and numeric codes
* No degree required but must be 18 years or older


**Job Considerations:**

*Strength and Endurance:* Cases may weigh as much as 60 pounds and may be stored from floor level to upper rack height of 60". Extended reach requirements to the back of a 48" long pallet may be necessary due to inaccessibility to the other three sides of the pallet, as well as the lengthwise orientation of the pallet in the rack. Carry distances may range from a few feet to several yards depending on where the forklift is positioned, and whether any obstructions exist in the aisle. Repeated lifts of heavy product, handing as much as 200 cases per hour and more than 1000 cases during a standard shift make this a moderate to heavy physical work position.


**Company**


General Trading is a grocery wholesale food distributor located in **Carlstadt, New Jersey**. We are a full service grocery wholesaler and dairy wholesaler, supplier, distributor, exporter carrying over 10,000 grocery and 2,000 dairy items.

title: Retail Store Manager in Training (MIT)
description:
**Store Hours:** Mondays - Fridays 10 AM - 8 PM, Saturdays 10 AM - 6 PM, Sundays 11 AM - 4 PM

**Company Description**

*The targeted hiring range for this Retail Store Manager in Training position is* ***$18.02 to $23.45 plus commission*** *depending on qualifications; however, the expanded salary range provides opportunities for advancement. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and job location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, competencies, experience, and relevant education, training or a combination of these things plus market demand. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range and benefits for your location during the hiring process.* 

You can find retail jobs just about anywhere. So, why work at Red Wing Shoes? From our purpose-built footwear to our stylishly designed stores, you’ll see the difference. From our life-friendly retail schedules to career advancement, you’ll feel the difference. And, when you create remarkable, in-store experiences for customers who build, shape, and protect the world around them -- you’ll make a difference. We’re not just retail. We are Red Wing.

**Job Description**

**GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB:**

The Store Manager-in-Training (MIT) will be immersed in learning all aspects of managing a Red Wing Shoe Store. Training will take place through on-the-job experiences while learning under the guidance of their Area Retail Manager (ARM), Region Operations Manager, and other partners. You will support the Red Wing Shoe store by building loyalty and long-lasting relationships with our customers. This is achieved by promoting our Ultimate Fit Experience, selling our premium products, and providing conscientious customer service.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Guide each customer through RWSC’s Ultimate Fit Experience
* Provide appropriate accessory recommendation, educate customers on the benefits of each
* Generate Industrial Sales Leads
* Achieve and exceed daily productivity and sales goals
* Maintain the integrity of the sales floor presentation, store signage, and housekeeping standards
* Maintain proficiency with product knowledge, technical, and operating standards through continuous learning
* Maintain safe and healthy work environment by following organization standards and legal regulations
* Support direct report in daily operations of the retail store
* Work directly with the Area Retail Manager to understand the inventory management process/procedures
* Work directly with ARM on store schedules, understanding labor model, and monthly store budgets
* Will assist ARM in analyzing monthly P&L statements to ensure store profitability
* Temporarily assume Store Manager responsibilities in a store without a Store Manager until one is appointed
* Provide store coverage in local market as determined by Region Operations Manager
* Work closely with the ARM in identifying training gaps and implementation of training at the store level
* Participate and assist in special projects such as relocations, grand opening events, and store remodels
* Take part in building and sustaining high employee morale

**OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Obtain necessary information by maintaining knowledge of RWSC’s electronic communication software
* Maintain quality service by establishing, following, and enforcing organization quality system standards
* Uphold Red Wing Shoe Company’s core values
* Willingness to perform additional duties as required
* Conduct self-accordance to RWSC policies
* Build collaborative relationships between you and key people with whom you’ll work or interact with

**Qualifications**

**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:**

* High School Diploma/GED or equivalent work experience
* 2 years relevant experience (retail preferred)
* Results oriented
* Effective Written/Verbal Communication
* Computer Utilization

**ADDITIONAL DESIRABLE QUALIFICATION AND COMPETENCIES:**

* Thorough knowledge of Red Wing Shoe Company’s mission, values, and organization structure
* Profit and loss knowledge
* Naturally curious, has passion for new ideas, and looks to drive growth
* Problem solving
* Retail Footwear

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

* Lifting 50 pounds, bending/squatting to lace shoes, overhead lifting, twisting, climbing a ladder, standing for long periods of time
* Housekeeping duties including but not limited to: vacuuming, mopping & waxing floors, washing windows, use of disinfectant chemicals, discarding of all trash, maintaining recycling, installing, and maintaining furniture, fixtures, and displays.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**

* Retail Store

**Additional information**

title: Laboratory Supervisor (Lab Technician
description:
Atlas is a nationwide leader in civil engineering, materials testing and geotechnical consulting services for environmental, industrial and infrastructure construction projects. Headquartered in Austin, TX, Atlas currently has over 3,500 employees in offices throughout the US. It’s no accident that Atlas creates a better experience for infrastructure and environmental projects. It’s how we are built – with the best people in the industry, with the reach and expertise to help at any and every step of the project, and with a heart-led approach that puts quality and safety at the center of everything we do. We’re just built to be better. We are a great company. Come join us!
  
  

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**  

The Laboratory Supervisor will assist in managing all activities related to performance of laboratory testing in support of the Avenel Construction Materials Testing Laboratory.
  
  

They will meet agreed upon project deadlines by performing testing; scheduling technicians and managing workload; They will confirm that technicians correctly perform testing, calibrations, and calculations and computations by implementing and maintaining the requirements of the Atlas Quality Management System; and train, coordinate and supervise assigned staff.
  
  

Works independently, using industry knowledge to solve problems of moderate scope.
  
  

Will be responsible for daily laboratory activities in the absence of the Laboratory Manager.
  
  

The successful candidate will bring strong leadership and knowledge of commercial laboratory operations.
  
  

**Minimum Re quirements:**  

5+ years of experience with laboratory testing of construction materials.
  
  

1+ year of experience as a Lab Manager or Supervisor (preferred)
  
  

Valid driver's license and ability to pass drug and MVR
  
  

High School Diploma or equivalent.
  
  

Associates Degree or Higher in Construction Technology, Construction Management or Related Engineering Field (preferred)
  
  

Ability to work independently and as a team member, maintaining composure, and working effectively in a high-pressure environment with changing priorities.
  
  

Must have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
  
  

Able to use a company provided laptop or tablet computer and a working knowledge of MS Office programs (e.g. Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.).
  
  

Organization and multi-tasking ability.
  
  

A good work ethic, attention to detail, and high level of personal integrity.
  
  

**Technical Requirements:**  

**American Concrete Institute (ACI) Certifications:**  

Aggregate Testing Technician - Level 1 or 2
  
Aggregate/Soils Base Testing Technician
  
Concrete Strength Testing Technician
  
Concrete Field-Testing Technician - Grade 1
  
Concrete Laboratory Testing Technician - Level 1 or 2
  
  

National Institute for Certification in Engineering Technologies (NICET):
  
  

**Construction Materials Testing:** Asphalt, Concrete, Soils (Levels I, II, or III)
  
  

**NJSAT Certifications:** HMA Plant Technologist Level 1
  
  

**Other Miscellaneous Qualities:**  

Familiarity with Lab Information Management Systems (LIMS)
  
  

ATLAS EEOC Statement
  
  

Atlas Technical Consultants is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.
  
  

This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Atlas Technical Consultants makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, read through our EEO Policy https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated\\_files/employers/poster\\_screen\\_reader\\_optimized.pdf

title: Room Attendant
description:
The Manhattan Club, New York City’s first Timeshare property is seeking a Room Attendant. This is a full-time position and candidates must be flexible and able to work days, nights, weekends, and holidays.

Room Attendants will perform all cleaning duties including but not limited to:

· Dusting, polishing, sweeping, washing, mopping, vacuuming, and shampooing in rooms, hallways, lobbies, lounges, restrooms, corridors, elevators, stairways, locker rooms, vending, and other work areas ensuring that The Manhattan Club standards and appropriate health standards are met.

· Making beds (including cots, rollaways, cribs, and pullout couches); this requires the mattress to be lifted slightly in order to tuck the linens underneath.

· Clean wash basins, mirrors, commodes, tubs, and showers daily.

· Load, run, and unload dishwasher as needed.

· Carry and restock linen, towels, toilet items, amenities, and cleaning supplies.

· Provide guests with specialty items such as cots, cribs, rollaway beds, boards and irons, hair dryers, extra linen and terry, and other items as necessary.

· Check all drawers, closets, and under beds for items left behind by previous guests.

· Empty wastebaskets and transport other trash and waste to disposal areas.

**Additional Requirements**

· High school diploma or equivalent

· Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer service. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.

· Knowledge of the English language and ability to communicate effectively in face to face situations as well as read instructions.

· Must be able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (7 hours or more).

· Frequent pushing, pulling, reaching, stretching, stooping, handling, and gripping is required. Ability to frequently lift or carry up to 25 lbs. Ability to occasionally lift or carry more than 25 lbs.

· Ability to walk down two flights of stairs and walk up one flight of stairs.

· Ability to arrange things in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules.

· Adhere to dress code policies as outlined in the employee handbook and maintain a polished and professional appearance at all times.

title: Youth Counselor
description:
Acacia Network, the leading Latino integrated care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing and community building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we’ve been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland and Puerto Rico.

**POSITION OVERVIEW**

Under the direction and supervision of the Program Director, SYEP Coordinator and Program Job Developer, the **Youth Counselor** will supervise and monitor SYEP participants at multiple work sites. Provide leadership, direction, training and support to SYEP participants at multiple work sites as well as performing both administrative and direct service tasks. Produce weekly programmatic reports on work sites' concerns and issues. Attend department meetings, as needed. Collect all SYEP relevant documents (e.g. timesheets, evaluations, ISS forms).

**The salary for the Youth Counselor** **is $15.20 - $20/per hour based on relevant experience.**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Assist with Facilitation of weekly educational workshops for program participants (ages 14-21) with a provided curriculum.
* Collection of timesheets on a weekly basis and ensure completion with accuracy.
* Cooperate and maintain a working relationship with the assigned worksite supervisors.
* Communicate with the Program Manager regarding any conflicts with worksite assignments.
* Maintain participant files, timesheets and evaluations.
* Attend all related meetings, trainings and supervisions as required. To perform this job successfully, the candidate must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Perform other duties as assigned.

**EDUCATION AND REQUIREMENTS:**

* **High School Diploma or High School Equivalency with 2 year’s work related experience related to customer service and administrative duties** ***(Bachelors Degree preferred)***
* Effective communications skills, both oral and written form
* Excellent organizational skills essential to maintain accurate records
* Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines
* Interact professionally with participants, staff, clients and community partners in a professional manner
* Work collaboratively with other team members to meet common goals
* Sensitivity and awareness to different cultures
* Conduct himself/herself as a professional as per policy on conduct, appearance and adherence to the overall organizational policy
* *Bilingual (Spanish speaking) preferred*
* Proficient Microsoft Office Suite computer knowledge (Excel, PowerPoint)
* *Experience working with Youth Development Services a plus*

**About Us:** Acacia Network, the leading Latino integration care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, and great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing, and community-building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we've been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland, and Puerto Rico.

**\\*Acacia Network is an equal opportunity employer\\***

title: Director, Account Management
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.


Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description**  

NBCUniversal Global Advertising & Partnerships is seeking a Director of Account Management a pivotal leadership role responsible for overseeing the Account Management function and growth within our organization. The ideal candidate will have robust experience partnering with agency holding companies across programmatic, streaming and linear executions. As a strategic thinker with a customer-centric mindset and focus on supporting business growth, this role will be crucial in maintaining and expanding the Account Management organization. This leader will oversee a team of account managers, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and champion client satisfaction and retention efforts. They will possess strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire, motivate, and develop a high-performing team.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Leadership and Team Management:**

* Responsible for leading a team goal and focused on driving incremental revenue, upselling & client retention.
* Provide ongoing support, guidance, and performance feedback to Account Managers, ensuring alignment with business goals while supporting potential career aspirations.
* Oversee the onboarding and training processes to ensure team members integrate smoothly and are set up for success. Routinely survey to understand or anticipates the training and development needs of the team.
* Excellence in relationship building and communication skills, with the ability to engage with internal and external senior-level executives.
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and all levels of management.

**Client Relationship Management:**

* Serve as an escalation contact for key clients, building and maintaining strong, long-term relationships.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service delivery and operational efficiency, furthering premium service standards to our clients.
* Implement performance and reporting deliverables to monitor and improve campaign performance.
* Possess expert understanding of linear and digital media management, digital and streaming campaign diagnostics, and optimization within a biddable auction advertising environment.

**Operational Excellence and Automation Strategy:**

* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service delivery and operational efficiency for the betterment of the ad revenue and clients.
* Oversee the operational aspects of account management, ensuring efficient processes, resource allocation, and compliance with industry standards.
* Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify opportunities, and drive strategic action.
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and all levels of management.

  

**Qualifications** **Basic Requirements:**

* 8+ years of proven client service management experience
* Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent Experience in Marketing, Advertising, Business, or a related field
* Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States
* Willingness to travel and work overtime, and on weekends with short notice
* Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV through nbcunicareers.com to be considered

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Strong leadership and mentoring skills with prior people management experience
* Resourceful self-starter; ability to work independently and adapt to change
* Deadline-driven and process-oriented personality
* Comfortable working in the fast-paced, dynamic and growing business

title: Warehouse Associate/Order Picker
description:

Warehouse Associates needed for a high volume, fast-paced environment. At BENDER, we believe in TEAM. We put a high priority on working hard and smart with a focus on providing the best service to our customers. We work best with people who can learn fast, think on their feet, and quickly become a part of the team. We are proud to announce that BENDER received an award from USA Today, as a top workplace in 2024 and one from Hartford Courant as a BEST PLACE TO WORK IN CT 2023!* **Would you like to be a part of a warehouse team where you are a valued member?**
* **Are you a person who strives to meet the standards of quality?**

Regular hours will likely be Monday-Friday 7:00AM-3:30PM with a 30-minute lunch.** **BENDER has a GREAT company culture and AWESOME benefits:*** Competitive compensation

**You WILL find opportunities for growth at BENDER. Apply now. Interviews are currently underway.**
