title: Operations Specialist
description:
**Requisition ID:** 106783  


**Share Our Purpose. Be Yourself. Feel Valued.**  


People are the heart of our business. As an American Water employee, you will be offered a competitive salary and health benefits package, along with opportunities to develop, grow, and evolve your career. Our benefits packages focus on key areas such as health & wellness, emotional & well-being, and savings for current & future goals.  


We are **Beautifully Different**. We strongly believe having diversity across our company makes us more successful and helps us provide essential services to our customers. We are stronger because we embrace different ideas, viewpoints, experiences, and backgrounds. American Water is the best choice for your next role! Click here for more information on our inclusion, diversity, and equity journey.  


**About American Water**  

American Water (NYSE: AWK) is the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the United States. With a history dating back to 1886, We Keep Life Flowing® by providing safe, clean, reliable and affordable drinking water and wastewater services to more than 14 million people across 14 regulated jurisdictions and 18 military installations. American Water’s 6,500 talented professionals leverage their significant expertise and the company’s national size and scale to achieve excellent outcomes for the benefit of customers, employees, investors and other stakeholders.  

  

As one of the fastest growing utilities in the U.S., American Water expects to invest $30 to $34 billion in infrastructure repairs and replacement, system resiliency and regulated acquisitions over the next 10 years. The company has a long-standing history of executing its core operations, aligned with sustainable best practices, through its commitments to safety, affordability, customer service, protecting the environment, an inclusive workforce and strengthening communities.  

  

American Water has been recognized on the 2023 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Indexfor the fifth consecutive year, ranked 18th on Barron’s 100 Most Sustainable U.S. Companies 2023 List, earned the U.S. Department of Homeland Security SAFETY Act designation and U.S. Environmental Protection Agency’s WaterSense® Excellence Award, among additional state, local and national recognitions.  

  

For more information, visit amwater.com and join American Water on LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.  


**New Jersey American Water** is seeking a highly motivated, organized professional to join our team as an **Operations Specialist.** This role will support our field distribution team in **Shrewsbury, NJ.** As the Operations Specialist, you will be responsible for providing office support including processing invoices, uploading documentation to internal systems, inputting work orders, applying for and securing permits, and more. Our ideal candidate will be computer savvy and have strong communication and time management skills.
**Primary Role**
----------------


*The Operations Specialist provides a combination of administrative, analytical and/or technical support pertaining to routine day-to-day operations for a department or functional area.*  

**Key Accountabilities**
------------------------


* Perform MapCall Supervisor approval, restoration processing, traffic control invoicing, mark out quality control, FUNO creation, manage BPEMS.
* Coordinate Training for field crews. (i.e., in-person, safety and applications).
* Perform Operational Observations in the Field for efficiencies and safety improvements.
* Review and provide feedback for the preparation and/or modification of survey sketches and street opening permits Etc.
* Communication to external affairs as it relates to projects and emergencies.
* Research, scanning, cataloging, creating, and maintaining spreadsheets; asset creation, deletion, and editing in MapCall/SAP, as well as the possibility of GIS editing within the ArcGIS environment.
* Uses and maintains relational databases and other reporting tools to compile, calculate, track, report and clean-up data pertaining to various reoccurring processes which may include, but are not limited to, capital programs, field projects, work orders, regulatory compliance, and employee records.
* Manage fleet as it pertains to local operations. Fleetio/ ARI / Fleet complete.
* Create, and close out projects for DISC and Developer Projects.
**Knowledge/Skills**
--------------------


* Thorough knowledge of standard business practices and principles, including basic accounting and budgeting.
* In depth Knowledge of MapCall.
* Code Red system.
* In-depth knowledge of Microsoft office suite applications including MSWord, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams.
* Knowledge of water or utility industry preferred.
* Knowledge of SAP asset creation/editing a plus.
* Ability to read and understand site/utility plans a plus.
* Knowledge of GIS/GPS a plus.
* Knowledge of AutoCAD, SAP, BlueBeam a plus.
* Demonstrated ability to work in a meticulous manner to ensure records are clearly and accurately maintained.
* Demonstrated organization and administrative skills.
* Demonstrated communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize tasks
* Demonstrated interpersonal skills.
* Ability to walk 5+ miles per day while carrying 15 pounds of equipment.
* Ability to operate a motor vehicle.
* Experience locating underground assets.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn.
* Functional/Technical Skills, Learning on the Fly, Organizational Agility Problem Solving, Time Management.
**Experience/Education**
------------------------


* High school diploma with post high school coursework in secretarial science, business, finance, or accounting required; associates level degree in business, finance, accounting or engineering preferred.
**Other Job Requirements**
--------------------------


* Water/wastewater certifications preferred.
* The percentage of time spent performing the key accountabilities of the job may vary based on the manager, departmental or functional unit needs.
* Sharing Knowledge & Expertise - drives business performance by developing and contributing specific technical or professional knowledge, skills, and experience.
* Demonstrates a professional attitude. Teamworking - Is committed to working collaboratively to achieve business goals, building cohesiveness and identity with a work group, and valuing individual perspectives and contributions.
* Valid driver’s license required.
**Hours/Schedule**
------------------


* Full-time
* Monday-Friday, 7:30am-4pm
* Overtime as needed
**Work Environment**
--------------------


* Ability to work in all elements of weather and standard office environment.
**Competencies**
----------------


Champions safety
Customer obsessed
Cultivates innovation
Nimble learning
Drives Results
Collaborates  

**Join American Water...****We Keep Life Flowing**™  


**American Water is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and prohibits employment discrimination for employees and applicants** **based on his or her age, race, color, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, citizenship, or because they are an individual with a disability, protected veteran or other status protected by federal, state, and local laws.**

title: Trade Compliance Analyst
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**



As a Trade Compliance Analyst, you will support Peloton in its execution of trade compliance strategy and ensure ongoing compliance with cross-border customs and other trade compliance requirements, wherever Peloton operates or conducts business. Reporting to Peloton's VP, Head of Safety, Ethics and Compliance, you will be part of Peloton's global compliance and ethics program, focusing on trade compliance, work with customs brokers, and management of third-party risks, oversee Peloton's Customs brokers, ensure timely, accurate & compliant payments of import duties, and generally maintain & strengthen Peloton's "reasonable care" controls. The ideal candidate for this role has experience with trade compliance work in a consumer product industry and experience with external service providers, Product, Legal, Supply Chain, Operations, Logistics, Tax and Finance.


**YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON**


* Advise customs brokers of clearance instructions or any specific import requirement relating to Peloton's products, parts, accessories, and apparel.
* Oversee, measure and audit the accuracy and timeliness of Peloton's global customs brokers in all markets where Peloton conducts business.
* Conduct regular audits of Peloton's import data and duty payments, utilizing CBP's ACE & CBSA's CARM portals.
* Evaluate and assign accurate global Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS) Classifications for Peloton's products.
* Support Peloton's duty drawback and value reconciliation programs.
* Maintain timely and complete Customs recordkeeping for Peloton's global imports and exports.
* Support Denied Party Screening (DPS) as part of Peloton's global economic sanctions compliance program.
* Assist in the creation and continuous improvement of Peloton's global trade compliance SOPs and policies.
* Proactively monitor & raise new trade compliance developments that have the potential to impact the business.


**QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE**


* Bachelor's degree and 3+ years of relevant experience working for an importer of consumer products, Customs broker and/or trade consultancy.
* Comprehensive knowledge of Customs regulations, the Harmonized Tariff Schedule, duty drawback, reconciliation and incoterms.
* Licensed Customs Broker preferred.
* Experience with ThomsonReuters OneSource GTM and NetSuite ERP preferred
* Demonstrates self-initiative and drive to meet deadlines and work in a diverse, fast paced environment
* Analytical with strong problem solving abilities and attention to detail
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong interpersonal and collaborative skills, with the ability to work cross functionally , external service providers and global teams.
* Excellent organizational skills.


#LI-ES2 #LI-Hybrid

  

**ABOUT PELOTON:**



Peloton (NASDAQ: PTON), provides Members with expert instruction, and world class content to create impactful and entertaining workout experiences for anyone, anywhere and at any stage in their fitness journey. At home, outdoors, traveling, or at the gym, Peloton brings together immersive classes, cutting-edge technology and hardware, and the Peloton App with multiple tiers to personalize the Peloton experience [with or without equipment]. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in New York City, Peloton has millions of Members across the US, UK, Canada, Germany, Australia, and Austria. For more information, visit www.onepeloton.com.



At Peloton, we motivate the world to live better. "Together We Go Far" means that we are greater than the sum of our parts, stronger collectively when each one of us is at our best. By combining hardware, software, content, retail, apparel, manufacturing, Member support, and so much more, we deliver an exhilarating fitness experience that unlocks our members' greatness. Join our team to unlock yours.



Peloton is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. Equal employment opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at Peloton, where all team members, applicants, and other covered persons are considered on the basis of their personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital and civil partnership/union status, alienage or citizenship status, creed, genetic predisposition or carrier status, unemployment status, familial status, domestic violence, sexual violence or stalking victim status, caregiver status, or any other protected characteristic as established by applicable law. This policy of equal employment opportunity applies to all practices and procedures relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment. If you would like to request any accommodations from application through to interview, please email: applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com


*Please be aware that fictitious job openings, consulting engagements, solicitations, or employment offers may be circulated on the Internet in an attempt to obtain privileged information, or to induce you to pay a fee for services related to recruitment or training. Peloton does NOT charge any application, processing, or training fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process. All genuine job openings will be posted* *here* *on our careers page and all communications from the Peloton recruiting team and/or hiring managers will be from an @**onepeloton.com* *email address.*


*If you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Peloton, please email* *applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com* *before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.*

title: Fryer Cleaner - Technician - Filta 420
description:
Since 1996, we have been providing unparalleled service around the world to restaurants and other food establishments. In an age of climate change, and economic stresses, our services are being recognized at the forefront by the food and hospitality industry. Customers are realizing more than ever before the many benefits to be gained from our services.

We are looking for a hardworking, trustworthy and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Cleaning Service Technician in the Fairfield, Ct area. In this role you will visit our restaurant and commercial food clients on a daily route to clean their frying equipment, restock their oil and supplies as well as any other service items our clients rely on us to deliver. We provide a mobile on-site service for the micro-filtration of cooking oil, the vacuum-based cleaning of deep fryers, and full fryer management to restaurants, hotels, colleges… in fact, wherever food is fried.

This role requires a dependable, hard-working individual with good people skills. We provide the required training to operate the equipment and perform the services.

We offer a set schedule of work with the possibility to increase the hours and/or days based on performance which translate into bonuses. We provide uniforms and protective equipment.

\\*\\****You are applying for work with a franchisee of Filta Environmental Kitchen Solutions, not The Filta Group, Inc. or any of its affiliates. If hired, the franchisee will be your only employer. Franchisees are independent business owners who set their own wage and benefit programs that can vary among franchisees.***

What are some characteristics we are looking for:

* Must possess a valid driver’s license (REQUIRED) with a good driving record
* Ability to establish credibility and communicate effectively verbally
* Must be able to read a map & follow the provided daily schedule
* Have great timeliness
* Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds
* The ability to work independently with little supervision

Some benefits that we offer:

* On the Job Training

Key Responsibilities

* Competence in time management, account monitoring and maintenance of equipment
* Keep van clean, stocked and well organized
* Memorize safety and emergency protocols
* Follow the provided schedule each week and be timely for appointments
* Maintain service records for each customer
* Keep a clean work area
* Provide friendly, high-quality customer service
* Adhere to all safety policies and procedures while wearing required PPE gear.
* Assure compliance with franchise standards/policies
* Ensure client site is clean and free from debris after each service
* Perform required daily and weekly maintenance
* Conduct Customer demonstrations of our service, as needed.
* Report any changes in management, staff, fryer oil or frying habits back to the office

Additional Qualifications helpful:

· Previous experience in machinery or other related fields a plus

· Strong mechanical aptitude and troubleshooting skills a plus

· Previous kitchen experience a plus

· Likes to work solo and be loved by the customers you service!

***You are applying for work with a franchisee of Filta Environmental Kitchen Solutions, not The Filta Group, Inc. or any of its affiliates. If hired, the franchisee will be your only employer. Franchisees are independent business owners who set their own wage and benefit programs that can vary among franchisees.***

title: Sales Training Curriculum Developer
description:
**About Pinterest**:



Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.



Creating a life you love also means finding a career that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences that you bring. As you read through the expectations of the position, consider how your skills and experiences may complement the responsibilities of the role. We encourage you to think through your relevant and transferable skills from prior experiences.


*Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that's uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our* *PinFlex* *landing page to learn more.*


The Sales Enablement (SE) team is a multidisciplinary team dedicated to training and learning, sales content guidance and management as well as leading sales programs that increases the effectiveness and efficiency of Sales. We're hiring a Curriculum Developer to help build and deliver best-in-class learning experiences for all global sellers at Pinterest.

  


**What you'll do:**


* Build our first comprehensive Sales eLearning program for Pinterest; excited by the opportunity to set a strategy and drive execution of materials for this crucial sales program.
* Collaborate with XFN SMEs to design the right learning experiences, including conducting learning needs assessments, building learning personas, and learning goals.
* Partner directly with subject matter experts to design and develop engaging experiences for a variety of audiences and delivery modes (live, e-learning, asynchronous) with clear strategies and tactics to achieve desired learning outcomes.
* Lead all phases of the learning design process to identify needs, define objectives, design the experience, develop content, document results, and maintain program curriculum.
* Define and report out metrics that assess learning effectiveness and/or opportunities.
* Partner closely with other Learning professionals on the team (and across Pinterest) to ensure learning experiences are fun, engaging, and help sellers adopt new skills and abilities.
* Partner with and communicate effectively, so that stakeholders, teammates, and leadership understand timelines and milestones.

  


**What we're looking for:**


* 7+ years experience in building and delivering a sales curriculum in an enterprise sales organization.
* Excellent written and communication skills with the ability to influence senior stakeholders.
* Proven ability to independently think and move quickly, manage multiple priorities, and make difficult tradeoffs to meet deadlines.
* Someone who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment to create online learning experiences on Pinterests rapidly evolving solutions.

  


**Relocation Statement:**


* This position is not eligible for relocation assistance. Visit our PinFlex page to learn more about our working model.

  


**In-Office Requirement:**


* We let the type of work you do guide the collaboration style. That means we're not always working in an office, but we continue to gather for key moments of collaboration and connection.
* This role will need to be in the office for in-person collaboration 2-3 times/month, and therefore can be situated in a commutable distance from one of the following offices: Los Angeles, CA, San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL, Atlanta, GA, New York, NY.

  



#LI-HYBRID



#LI-AT6

**Our Commitment to Diversity:**



Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. title: Child Support Professional - CRD016 - On Call
description:
* **The Child Support Professional is a compassionate and dedicated member of the Community Residence Program team, focused on providing a safe and therapeutic environment for children and adolescents with serious emotional disturbances. Reporting to the Program Supervisor/Social Worker and the Program Director, this individual plays a critical role in offering specialized care, supervision, and therapeutic activities to residents.**


**ESSENTIAL ACCOUNTABILITIES**
------------------------------
* Individualized Resident Care: Offer tailored supervision and care for each resident, ensuring their safety and well-being.
* Behavioral Modeling: Demonstrate positive behaviors and embody the programs core values to influence residents constructively.
* Strength-Based Practices: Utilize strength-based techniques to foster resilience and asset-building among the youth.
* Skill Development: Assess and instruct residents in daily and independent living skills, while also tracking their progress.
* Therapeutic Environment: Maintain a nurturing and therapeutic milieu, encouraging appropriate socialization and emotional growth.
* Household Management: Create a homely atmosphere, showing responsibility in carrying out household duties alongside residents.
* Service Planning: Actively participate in the development and review of service plans, aligning with individual goals and objectives.
* Trauma-Informed Care: Apply trauma-sensitive practices in all interactions and care provided to residents.
* Transport and Supervision: Accompany residents to various appointments and activities, providing necessary supervision and transportation.
* Family Engagement: Promote and facilitate family involvement and potential reunification, maintaining regular communication and employing strength-based strategies.
* Counseling Support: Offer both formal and informal counseling and support to residents, contributing to their emotional and social development.
* Medication Management: Ensure strict adherence to prescribed medication regimens for each resident.
* Behavioral Support: Aid residents in managing their behavior and provide crisis intervention when necessary.
* Reporting: Promptly report any incidents or unusual occurrences to the supervisor and complete required documentation.
* Documentation: Ensure all assigned reporting and documentation are completed accurately and submitted in a timely manner.
* Residential Upkeep: Assist with residence upkeep, including general cleaning, laundry, shopping, meal planning and preparation, and coach residents in these skills.
* Ad Hoc Tasks and Organizational Commitment: Willingly attend unique events, such as the annual Family Bonds retreat, and perform other duties as assigned, demonstrating a versatile and dedicated approach to the comprehensive well-being of the youth and the overarching mission of the organization.


The role demands a minimum of a high school diploma, with experience in managing children with emotional challenges, and prefers candidates with an Associate's degree. Must have a valid New York State driver's license.

title: Recreational Lead Chef & Operations Manager
description:
**JOB TITLE: Full-Time Recreational Lead Chef/Operations Manager**

**REPORTS TO: Vice President of Culinary Operations**

**OVERVIEW:** The Institute of Culinary Education runs the largest and broadest hands-on recreational cooking program in America. Founded in 1975, this program has helped define what a modern cooking school could, and should be. The program draws customers from around the nation and world, and has won IACP awards for excellence. Reporting directly to the Director of Recreation, the Recreational Lead Chef will manage the other Chefs within the division. The Recreational Lead Chef will work a minimum of 25 office hours per week and teach a minimum of 260 recreational classes per year.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

Program Administration (for those programs under your supervision)

* Set and maintain overall standards
* Instructor recruitment, interview and recommendation process
* Administer all instructor evaluations
* Oversee the Bi-weekly Payroll and adjust related grievances
* Daily Monitoring/supervision of Culinary Operations Assistants
* Manage the divisions overall food costing

Content/Recipe Development (for those programs under your supervision)

* Stay current on trends and determine new classes to be provided at ICE
* Execute all R+D for these classes and develop the overall curriculum using independent judgment
* Engage instructors for R+D as needed

Scheduling (for those programs under your supervision)

* Ensure all events are staffed properly
* Responsible for booking and scheduling instructors for recreational classes
* Maintain working relationships wit NYC chefs and restaurants for recreational class scheduling (hiring the chef or engaging the restaurant as needed)
* Source new instructors as needed – recruitment, interviews and recommendations

Recreational Division & School Representative:

* Periodic weekend responsibility, serve as ambassador for VIP chefs / special events
* Ongoing general role as an ICE “ambassador” within the larger metro NYC culinary community

Calendar Upkeep

* Management of internal calendar

Teaching responsibilities

* Teach a minimum of 350 recreational classes a year, including night and weekends.
* Lead recreational classes in conformity with ICE lesson plans.
* Demonstrate techniques and concepts as required by the curriculum.
* Deliver clear, concise and organized lectures as required by the curriculum.
* Maintain a positive, focused learning environment during class.
* Ensure that recreational classes are conducted in a manner that complies with principles of food safety and sanitation.
* Provide the Vice President of Culinary Operations with weekly reports on classes with suggestions and plans for improvements.
* Oversee Culinary Operations Assistant staff during class times and assist in recruitment, interview and recommendation process
* Set standards for kitchen cleanliness and organization and oversee kitchen management according to ICE’s Official Kitchen Standards using independent judgement.
* Ensures proper ingredients and appropriate quantities are ordered in a timely manner in the appropriate format through the Stewarding department.
* Obtain license to teach and trail our Culinary Career Program.

You also may be assigned additional duties/responsibilities by ICE.

**BACKGROUND & SKILLS**

* Culinary/Pastry diploma and/or some form of formal Culinary Education
* Minimum of 7 years culinary experience, with management experience.
* Previous teaching experience preferred
* Excellent communication skills both written and verbal; strong presentation and interpersonal skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft suite of products including Outlook, PowerPoint, Word and Excel
* Demonstrated ability to interact in a collaborative manner with other departments and teams.
* Highly organized, detail oriented and proficient at multi-tasking
* True and demonstrated passion for multiple dimensions of the culinary universe.
* Flexible to work weekends
* Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills required
* Experience writing, editing or testing recipes
* Experience in service business operations
* Existing contacts in the NYC culinary community

**To Apply:**

* Please send letter and resume to: **HR @ ice. edu**

The Institute of Culinary Education is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Production Supervisor
description:
**Title:** Production Supervisor

 **Reports To:** Director of Manufacturing and Manufacturing Manager  

  

**Location:** New Brunswick, New Jersey

 **Shift:** 8:30 am – 5:00 pm  

  

**Role Description**  

  

We’re about Teamwork! We have successfully created effective teams to solve our clients’ problems. As an integrated distributor of laboratory supplies, unique services, and self-manufactured products, we seek someone with a can-do attitude to find solutions for our clients. The individual contributor role is for a Production Supervisor. Excellent opportunity to join a premier medical and laboratory supply company at its headquarters in New Brunswick.

  

  

**What You’ll Do**

  

Supervises the daily activities of a production area to ensure that product standards are achieved in conjunction with Cenmed’s Director and Manager of Manufacturing. Coordinates daily production activities to maximize efficiency and productivity. Monitors production activities, identifies problems, and helps troubleshoot root causes and develop solutions. Suggests improvements to improve efficiency or safety. Work with teams to ensure all order processing and production activities are performed accordingly.

 **Responsibilities:*** Demonstrated knowledge of process improvement methodologies - Lean, Six Sigma, 6S, or other disciplines
* Ability to work independently as well as the ability to coordinate activities with different departments
* Ensures that all production activities are in conformance with product specifications and quality standards
* Verify, control, and assure that manufacturing outputs are within the product specifications.
* Participate in regular safety and quality sessions as required
* Develop short and mid-range strategies/goals for operational excellence. Works with the Director and Manager of Manufacturing to develop long-range strategies/goals.
* Participate in and know about continuous improvement initiatives and other production-enhancing processes. Coach and mentor these principles down to the shop floor.
* Work with teams to ensure that all order processing and daily production activities are performed according to workflow.
* Work with other departments in the organization to create a cohesive atmosphere in which lines of communication are open and profitable results are generated.

 **Work Experience:*** Typically requires 3+ years’ experience in the related area as an individual contributor.
* Thorough knowledge of functional areas under supervision.
* To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential duties satisfactorily.

**Skills Required:*** Some working knowledge or experience with ERP systems, preferably Dynamics 365 Business Central
* Intermediate-level computer skills in Microsoft Office; Microsoft Excel and SharePoint skills desired
* Have some knowledge of QA concepts and processes as well as exposure to OSHA, ISO, and FDA standards.
* Confidence in own capacity and judgment. Must be willing to face challenging situations.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities at one time through highly developed organizational skills
* Ability to maintain a safe working environment through proper housekeeping and safety practices
* Excellent communication skills,oral, written and listening
* Ability to adjust communication style to multiple audiences and information sharing
* Excellent people skills - maintain a positive attitude and ability to motivate people, specifically mentoring and coaching individuals in identifying short- and long-term development needs and providing appropriate support
* Developed the ability to build personal relationships based on trust, mutual respect, and open communication
* Ability to adjust approach to demands and task requirements, adjust behavior to others’ styles, change priorities to meet changing demands, and adjust quickly to new responsibilities and tasks.
* Ability to pick up skills and tasks for the department as needed

 **Physical Job Requirements:*** Noise levels in the work environment can be moderate to high.
* The plant facility is subject to the same general climate conditions of the region (heat, cold, humidity, etc.).
* Chemicals, dust, pollen, and other typical airborne particulate matter are present in the atmosphere of the production floor and may create some odors in the plant. The Company limits exposure to chemicals through written procedures, engineering controls, and PPE to provide its employees with a safe and healthy working environment.
* While some chemicals may pose health risks if not properly used, employees are trained on the proper safety equipment and procedures for handling chemicals.

 **Perks & Benefits**

  

* Medical, Dental, Vision & Basic Life Insurance
* 401K with company match
* A variety of voluntary benefits, such as short-term disability
* Competitive Salary, Performance Bonus
* Flexible Time Off Program
* Referral Bonus Program
* Fun Culture

  

We recognize that people bring a wealth of experience and talent beyond the technical requirements of a job. You should apply if your experience is similar to what is listed here. Diversity of knowledge and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.

 **About Us**  

  

Established in 1992, Cenmed has grown to a fully integrated distributor, manufacturer, and services provider, representing over 2000 manufacturers, and selling globally. Our business philosophy is simple: We work hard to bring you cost-effective healthcare and laboratory supply solutions while focusing on helping our clients increase profitability.

  

At Cenmed Enterprises, we strive to maintain a progressive corporate culture that enables innovation and collaborative teamwork. Cenmed provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: REGISTERED NURSE (PART-TIME)
description:
**THIS POSITION HAS A $1,500 SIGN ON BONUS** 

Provides coordinated health care services for individuals; and assures optimal health care services for the individuals in accordance with the philosophy and objectives of the agency.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES**

* Maintains the mission of Person-Centered Planning.
* Performs pre-admission evaluations of new individuals – 30-day post admission evaluation and review.
* Performs or provides health appraisal procedures as needed.
* Evaluates, teaches and documents self-medication steps to individuals if needed.
* Maintain accurate, up-to-date medical records, in compliance with state regulations.
* Prepares consents for psychotropic medications needed for Human Rights.
* Schedules all annual medical/dental evaluations, and any follow-up appointments that are recommended at any medical appointments.
* Confers with Dietitian on all dietary plans.
* Follows up on all hospitalization and emergency treatment recommendations to ensure optimal medical care is received.
* Reviews and interprets medical reports received. Relates pertinent information to appropriate personnel, family or physician as indicated or requested.
* Maintains accurate, up-to-date medical records, in compliance with state regulations.
* Participates as a member of an Interdisciplinary Team incorporating the individual’s health status or medical needs in the treatment plan.
* Accompanies individuals to medical appointments when necessary.
* Seeks out community physicians, dentists, pharmacists and any other medical service as needed in order to provide optimal health care.
* Provides in-service and instructions to staff, re: medical conditions of individuals, medications, treatments and/or changes, to ensure that the needs and safety of the individuals are met.
* Supervises and instructs med-certified staff in medications/treatments. Med-certifies staff that have completed an appropriateOPWDD AMAP course. Re-certifies med staff annually and evaluates med staff semi-annually as dictated.
* Periodically observes staff in performance of medication pouring.
* Be available to med staff (via telephone within 30 minutes) for medical emergencies/medication concerns, during “off” hours/days.
* Assures individuals’ prescriptions are promptly filled/renewed and recorded as needed.
* Routinely checks medications for expiration dates – dispose/discard meds as policy dictates. Reviews individuals’ medications frequently.
* Follows OSHA recommendations (when applicable) to decrease communicable diseases
* Prepares reports and attends Semi-Annual and Annual meetings.
* Coordinates the medical health care needs of individuals who vacation away from their residence with the medical personnel of the vacation facility. Have proper medication prescribed for the vacation.
* Ensures that medications are available and prepared for individuals any home visits.
* Confers with Medicaid Service Coordinator and Program Manager to incorporate the health care/medical needs of the individual into his/her daily program.
* Prepares Surrogate Decision-Making packets for those individuals that must undergo medical intervention and do not have legal guardians. · Travel to more than one site and/or remote work may be required as per OPWDD Administrative Directive “Performing Nursing Services and Duties Remotely in OPWDD Certified Programs and Settings,”

**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**

* RN Associates Degree and NYS Registered Nurse Certification required.
* Three (3) years of experience working as a Registered Nurse and knowledge of developmental disabilities preferred. Or, two (2) years of
* experience working as an RN, PLUS, three years working as an LPN in a developmental disabilities or mental health agency.

title: Sales Associate
description:
Our Story
Madewell is a community-driven clothing destination that champions creativity, inclusivity, and self-expression. With denim at the brand’s core, Madewell also offers all the tenets of a great wardrobe, from easy tees and timeless outerwear to classic footwear and last-forever bags. Beyond impeccably designed products, Madewell also distinguishes itself through a number of meaningful sustainability initiatives, a best-in-class customer loyalty program, and community-driven initiatives including Hometown Heroes and Labels We Love. For more information, visit madewell.com and follow us @madewell.
Job Summary
As a Sales Associate, you act as a brand ambassador bringing your own personal style, passion for the product and welcoming energy to the sales floor each day. You’ll create genuine connections, helping customers to find their own unique look. You’ll collaborate with your team members and managers to drive the business, jump in on tasks that help create a seamless customer experience, and bring a collaborative, kind, and inclusive energy to the sales floor.

* Assist in store tasks—our customers should always see us at our best.
* Share feedback, insights and ideas with the management team.

(About you) You’ll be great in the role if you …* Make the best first impression—smile, welcome and connect with customers authentically.

* Do what it takes to create seamless, amazing experiences customers can’t stop talking about.
* Bring your best to everything you do and achieve your goals.
* Are flexible, and ready to have fun along the way.
* Leverage technology, while also knowing that devices don’t dominate the dialogue.
* Build productive relationships with everyone on the team and always respect each other.
* Are at least 18 years old.
* Are available when we are busy, including: nights, weekends and holidays.
* Can bend, reach, stretch as well as lift, carry and move at least 40 pounds | 18 kilos.

Before we wrap, a word about a few of our way cool perks…* Competitive base pay and bonus programs

title: FPA Provider Enrollment Analyst I - Medicine Administration
description:
The Provider Enrollment Analyst (I) is responsible for coordinating the provider enrollment and payer credentialing efforts for contracted FPA providers with Medicare and Medicaid. This individual manages all open provider enrollment tasks/ issues to ensure that providers are reimbursed for services provided and billed, and performs data analysis and special projects as assigned.

**Responsibilities**

1. Enrolls and terminates providers with CMS and other government programs by completing 855 series forms, gathers credentials and associated documentation required for enrollment and process enrollment forms.

2. Tracks status of "in process" enrollment forms until final approval received.

3. Files provider ID numbers once assigned by governing agencies and performs system updates as appropriate.

4. Responsible for the initial setup of new groups and providers for 837P and 835P EDI transactions as well as EFT.

5. Monitors TES edits, BAR edits, eCommerce edits, and payer denials for issues related to enrollment, and follow-up on claims until resolved.

6. Participates in CBO rebilling efforts due to provider enrollment issues.

7. Communicates with providers and other departments to escalate issues, share information and promote the process of obtaining documentation required for enrollment.

8. Assists department administrators and providers in performing online PECOS enrollment.

9. Assists in the Revalidation letter process, downloading list from CMS, obtaining comparison reports from the Medicare Provider Enrollment Database and scheduling providers for online re-enrollment.

10. Utilizes the reports within the Medicare Provider Database to monitor updates, promptly complete work orders and identify work to be completed.

11. May assist in special projects, generates metrics, and provides reconciliations, research, and analyses as directed by Management.

12. Assists management with Meaningful Use and PQRI tracking and reporting.

13. Supports activities related to internal and external audits of providers and/or departments.

14. Responds to inquiries and provide information as requested.

15. Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* Two years minimum of healthcare experience including Medicare or Medicaid Provider or Facility Enrollment or Credentialing experience required, including one year of revenue cycle-specific as well as direct customer service.

**Employer Description**

**Strength Through Diversity**

The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity, equity, and inclusion are key drivers for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai’s unrivaled record of achievement, education, and advancement as we revolutionize medicine together. We invite you to participate actively as a part of the Mount Sinai Health System team by:

* Using a lens of equity in all aspects of patient care delivery, education, and research to promote policies and practices to allow opportunities for all to thrive and reach their potential.
* Serving as a role model confronting racist, sexist, or other inappropriate actions by speaking up, challenging exclusionary organizational practices, and standing side-by-side in support of colleagues who experience discrimination.
* Inspiring and fostering an environment of anti-racist behaviors among and between departments and co-workers.

At Mount Sinai, our leaders strive to learn, empower others, and embrace change to further advance equity and improve the well-being of staff, patients, and the organization. We expect our leaders to embrace anti-racism, create a collaborative and respectful environment, and constructively disrupt the status quo to improve the system and enhance care for our patients. We work hard to create an inclusive, welcoming and nurturing work environment where all feel they are valued, belong and are able to advance professionally.

Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our history!

title: Associate Merchant - Men's
description:
Our Story
Simply put, we make great jeans and all the cool stuff you wear with them. And, beyond our devotion to premium denim, we believe in putting people and planet first in everything we do from our commitment to sustainable production to our focus on broadening opportunity and building belonging.  

Whether you’re taking the first step in your career or are looking for an exciting new opportunity, we have a wide array of challenging and creative roles for you. We foster a collaborative, community-driven and innovative environment in our stores, home office, and distribution and call centers. Want in?
Our dedication to Diversity, Equity, Belonging & Sustainability has been celebrated with industry recognition, reflecting our commitment to fostering an inclusive and sustainable workplace.
The Role + Purpose:
An Associate Merchant is responsible for helping to manage the execution of seasonal assortments, acting as point person for cross-functional business partners in production, marketing, design, allocation, and planning. They help to drive strategy for the categories they are managing.* Build an on-trend Omni assortment with channel-specific strategies in mind
* Initiate market/competitor analysis and always be on top of industry trends
* Communicate changes to all cross-functional partners - planning, production, design and wholesale
* Participate in store visits
* Prepare and analyze Omni selling recaps to drive your business. Make recommendations on how to optimize current sales and affect future plans
* Partner with planning in pre-season to plan and buy your department based on comprehensive analysis of the business – last year results, current business, etc
* Participate in inventory management and control with planning and distribution teams
* Participate with pricing and profit strategies – make promotional and markdown suggestions to drive profitable gross margin results
* Review new receipts against business trend to maximize sales and stock
  

Qualifications:* 3+ years’ Merchandising experience
* Proficient in Excel
* Demonstrated analytical and business skills
* Strong presentation skills

We welcome you to apply, even if you don't check all the boxes. Our passion is scouting life-long learners who are driven by curiosity, and who feel connected to our brands and share our desire to make an impact. We’re always seeking bright new talent who leverage their unique experiences to discover, grow and evolve with our teams.
Benefits + Perks* Health & Well-being - Eligible associates and family members receive medical, dental, prescription and vision insurance, family planning (fertility, adoption & surrogacy support), fitness discounts, medical travel and more.
* Associate Discount - We love our products just as much as you do! That’s why we offer a great associate discount across all of our brands (J.Crew, J.Crew Factory, and Madewell).
* Flex Fridays - In addition to our hybrid work model, we also close our office at 1:00 PM every Friday year-round.
* Community Impact - We support the communities where we live and work through our philanthropic efforts and the J.Crew Cares Program.
* Winter Break - In addition to our PTO package, J.Crew Group offers a winter break at the end of December to eligible full-time associates at the Home Office to provide time to refresh and recharge.

title: Quality Assurance Information Specialist for I/DD Field- Somerset, NJ
description:
**Job description**

**Quality Assurance Information Specialist I**

Everas Community Services, Inc. has been providing community-based services to people with intellectual and developmental disabilities for more than 40 years. Our extensive experience includes services for people across a spectrum of abilities and specialized needs including people who are deaf-blind, deaf, or blind, people with intensive medical and behavioral support needs, and people with autism spectrum disorder. Through our work to help people thrive and be empowered to contribute to their greatest capacity, we are making a positive difference in the lives of our clients, our employees, and the greater community. Join our team of professional staff committed to providing support services with care, quality, and respect throughout nine counties in NJ.

**Summary**

As a member of our Quality Assurance Team, the QAIS I ensures program quality standards are implemented in all departments through review of program data. The QAIS I supports program services integrity and compliance with all regulatory bodies and Everas policies and procedures, as well as makes specific recommendations to abate issues and continuously benchmark standards. QA Team members support program supervisors by providing direct guidance to staff, identifying agency trends, and implementing proactive and creative solutions in areas that require attention. Your commitment to excellence in disability services, collaborative mindset, professionalism, and high-level organizational skills are needed to achieve the best possible outcomes for the people in our programs.

**Quality Assurance Information Specialist Duties include but are not limited to:**

* Conduct all required investigations and inquiries within required timeframes
* File all Unusual Incident Reports in a timely, thorough, and accurate manner
* Participate in staff training to support employee development and performance, and ensure quality service provision
* Evaluate agency wide incident data to make proactive recommendations to prevent accidents and injury
* Support program documentation compliance as required

**What we offer:**

* Rewarding, mission-based work, supporting an improved quality of life for people with disabilities
* Paid training/professional development opportunities
* Paid time off
* Medical Insurance Plan
* Retirement Plan
* Referral Incentive Program
* Flexible Schedule
* Student Loan Forgiveness Program

**Job Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree with minimum 1 year of related work experience OR HS Diploma with minimum 5 years related experience
* **Experience in the I/DD field is required**
* Experience in information synthesis and analysis
* Detail oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills
* Flexible schedule to include evenings/weekends
* Criminal Background Check
* Valid NJ Driver’s license
* Willingness to meet NJ Executive Order 252, which requires employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, including a booster; at minimum one dose is required to begin employment with the expectation to complete subsequent doses as per recommended time frames; this requirement may be waived only in exceptional circumstances as outlined in the law.

title: Substance Use Specialist, ACT Team
description:
***Who is Bridging Access to Care, Inc.:*** *Bridging Access to Care, Inc. (BAC) is a nonprofit, multi-service, community-based behavioral health care organization committed to building healthy communities, one person at a time.*

*Brooklyn Aids Task Force was the very first HIV/AIDS organization in Brooklyn prioritizing serving persons living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) since 1986. In 2012, Brooklyn Aids Task Force changed its name to BAC and successfully made the transition from an AIDS-centered organization to a multi-service community-based healthcare organization. Today, BAC provides mental health and substance use-related social services, comprehensive HIV/AIDS care, and coordinated health care and supportive services to under-served racial and ethnic minority communities in the Brooklyn and other parts of New York City.*

*Bridging Access to Care, Inc. offers* a competitive salary package, including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and opportunities for professional development.

**JOB SUMMARY:**

Under the direct supervision of the Program Director within our *Behavioral Health, ACT*, the ***Substance Use Specialist*** takes the lead responsibility for integrating dual-recovery treatment with the tasks of other team members. The ***Substance Use Specialist*** is responsible but not limited to managing a caseload of clients and providing them with individual and group sessions to educate the substance uses participants population.

**EDUCATION:**

Minimum HS Diploma or equivalent with valid CASAC.

Minimum One (1) year experience/training in integrated mental health and substance abuse assessment/treatment, Motivational Interviewing techniques.

**CERTIFICATION:** CASAC-T, CASAC, CASAC-2 or Advance CASAC Strongly *Required*

**DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Monitor client’s involvement with treatment and help to assist barriers within their recovery progress.
* Provide clinical recommendations based on assessments and needs of the participant
* Facilitate Crisis Intervention as needed
* **Be available on off hours to consultant for crisis intervention**
* Work with participating youths on treatment adherence issues with medications, provide referrals to support services and ongoing support to encourage retention in services
* Complete related substance uses assessments and care coordination
* Provide psychosocial counseling-recovery-wellness-education-reoccurrence prevention
* Document all interventions/assessment timely and accurately
* Knowledgeable of substance use treatment, including harm reduction techniques, Narcan, and MAT.
* Conduct discharge plans for participants
* Other case management duties as required based off program needs.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:**

* Strong individual and group counseling skills for working with participants with substances use disorders
* Demonstrated ability to execute motivational interviewing techniques
* Familiarity with psychotropic and addiction treatment medications, expected outcomes, and adverse side effects
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Strong self-awareness
* Ability to work as a team member and maintain professional boundaries
* Must have experience using electronic health record system
* Good organization skills
* Adhere to deadlines
* ***Must be willing to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as required by the position***

Job Type: Full-time

Expected hours: No less than 35 per week

description:

We are seeking a skilled Echo Technician/Sonographer to join our team. The ideal candidate will perform diagnostic ultrasound examinations for patients under the supervision of physicians. This role requires proficiency in operating ultrasound equipment to capture images and conduct examinations related to cardiac anatomy and function.

* Proficient in operating ultrasound equipment and conducting diagnostic procedures.

description:
**Job Description:**

**Position Details:**

* Starting Hourly Rate - $17.36 (Then $18.60 PLUS Performance Incentives after 90 Days)
* Schedule/Hour: Sunday-Friday (1 day off during week & Saturdays off) Evening starting at 6PM until Finish (Full-Time)

**We Deliver the Goods:**

* Competitive pay and benefits, including Day 1 Health & Wellness Benefits, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, 401K Employer Matching, Education Assistance, Paid Time Off, and much more
* Growth opportunities performing essential work to support America’s food distribution system
* Safe and inclusive working environment, including culture of rewards, recognition, and respect

**Position Summary:**  

  

Select cases and other containers of food and non-foods products to fill customer orders from multi-level rack warehouse storage systems. Items are placed on pallets and completed orders are moved to the loading dock staging area with an electric pallet jack/forklift, wrapped, labeled, and readied for shipment in a timely manner observing all safety regulations and ensuring all quality standards are met while maintaining the efficient flow of product through the production process. Functions as a team member within the department and organization, as required, and perform any duties assigned to best serve the company.  

  

**Position Responsibilities:**

* Follow all preferred work methods, safety policies and procedures per company guidelines. Ensure work area is safe and report any unsafe conditions and/or acts immediately.
* Review work schedule, obtain supplies required to perform the work and prepare for operations. Perform a safety check on pallet jack/forklift to be used and insure that all other safety devices are functioning properly. Put on all required Personal Protective Equipment and Safety Gear.
* Meet required productivity and accuracy standards per location and company guidelines.
* Place pallets on pallet jack and operate along assigned multi-level racks and locate products according to order sheets.
* Manually place the appropriate stock items on pallet from pick slots and racks as required. Use single and/or double pallets as directed.
* Transport completed palletized customer order to shipping dock staging area. May be required to shrink-wrap pallet for staging.
* Remove batteries requiring recharging, replace with charged batteries, or attach re-charger and complete vehicle inspection checklist. At the end of the shift secure all equipment and complete all necessary paperwork.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

  

Click Here for a Job Preview

**Qualification:**

* Must be able to work the scheduled / assigned times and required overtime for the position

  

* Able to stand, walk, reach and lift repeatedly throughout shift

  

* Able to lift, stack, and/or pull products off shelves, as well as replenish product, from various heights weighing between 10-35 pounds and generally up to between approximately 60 and 90 pounds, depending on the location, throughout shift.

  

* Able to work in multi-temperature environments, i.e. cooler, freezer and dry

  

* Pass post offer pre-employment drug test

title: Ophthalmology Medical Billing Specialist
description:
P.M. Medical Billing, the largest National Ophthalmology Billing Company is once again hiring! We are a full-service medical billing firm specializing in Ophthalmology, providing clients all over the country with the most expert knowledge and service.

We welcome you to join the original, fastest-growing and most successful national Ophthalmology specific medical billing company. Our rapid and continuous growth with multiple clients in every state has necessitated our need to hire enthusiastic, knowledgeable and dependable billers and assistants to help us bring our doctors excellent service.

We are hoping to hire full-time medical billers who are experienced in Ophthalmology, however we will consider other specialties.

title: Sheet Metal Fabrication (Night Shift) (10:00pm - 6:30am) $20-$25 hrly
description:
Thank you for your interest in becoming part of the team at Legrand!
GENERAL PURPOSE
This position is responsible for safely setting up, operating, and shutting down various CNC fabricating, forming & VMC Machines. This position will have the responsibility to ensure the machine parts and production units are meeting or exceeding the required quality standards. Must also have the ability to train and work, and at times, lead continuous improvement teams. Work assignments will be scheduled based on training proficiency.
DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES* 1st piece set-up/inspection against engineering drawing and transferring all necessary information to the operation to ensure efficient and accurate production run.
* Must perform all necessary/routine QC checks during set-up and if any problems occur during run.
* Work closely with Supervisor and Team Leader to ensure proper priority of work is performed according to the job board.
* May be responsible for organizing, sharpening and maintaining tools, dies, etc.
* Trains and/or instructs operators following Supervisor’s instructions.
* Plans ahead (material, fixtures, paperwork) so next job is set-up prior to completion of existing jobs.
* Performs routine set-up and troubleshooting.
* Maintains the machine tooling by routinely cleaning and checking the tools.
* Communicates with Supervisor or Team Leader about any problems and the priority of setting up the next job.
* Conducts basic quality checks within the parameters of the position.
* Makes routine adjustments, up to and including tools at time to assure parts are within tolerance.
* Must check parts to print using proper QC measuring equipment.
* Load/unload machines and may check basic cross-reference information to assure correct part is being processed.
* Perform any lower level duties such as filing, sanding, etc.
* Can work on any job within the department set up and trouble shoots jobs.
* Works responsibly and efficiently adhering to all safety rules and policies.
* Assures that basic quality checks are performed at specific intervals on machine parts.
* Works responsibly and efficiently, adhering to all safety rules and policies while maintaining good housekeeping practices.
* Inform area management of any hazardous situations in the work environment.
* Perform any other duties required by Supervisor/Fabrication Manager to ensure realization of departmental and corporate goals.
* Good motor coordination, including sequencing and processing parts.
* Participate, and as required lead Continuous Improvement Teams.
* Complete clean-up responsibilities and maintain workstation according to 5S procedure.
* Understand workplace hazards and take steps to proactively prevent and report hazards or injuries in the workplace. Cooperate in safety programs, initiatives, and investigations.
* Perform other duties deemed necessary to support the Company’s business operations.


JOB REQUIREMENTS
Essential Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:* Basic math skills, communication and troubleshooting skills
* Demonstrated ability to use and interpret measurement tools such as tape measure and calipers
* Ability to read and interpret Engineering drawings, BOM’s and associated procedures
* Ability to follow directions and work with minimal supervision
* Flexibility and willingness to adapt to frequently changing priorities/tasks
* Demonstrated mechanical aptitude
* Basic math skills and problem-solving skills
* Ability to set-up and operate some of the CNC equipment
* Ability to identify, participate, lead and communicate basic process improvements
* Works well in a team environment
* Capability to train others in manufacturing CNC techniques
* Provide training to other associates
* Proven reliability – attendance and punctuality
* Must understand basic lean principles - 5S, Kanban
* Ability to read, write and speak English is preferred


Minimum Education and Experience:* High school diploma, GED or technical Certification preferred.
* 4 or more years of previous experience in operating specific specialized equipment or 3 years of demonstrated experience operating and set up CNC equipment.


WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand for 8 hours/day while making coordinated movements of the hands and fingers to grasp/pinch, manipulate and assemble objects. This may include frequent use of vibrating/pneumatic tools, overhead and outstretched reaching with arms, bending/twisting/stooping, kneeling/squatting and frequently lifting/carrying up to 50 lbs. throughout the day and occasionally push/pull/lift up to 100 lbs. as needed. Although on a regular basis lifting requirements may not exceed 40 lbs. Occasionally, depending on the tasks assigned for the day, you may have to sit or stand more or less frequently. Work may be repetitive in nature.
* May be exposed to sharp edges
* May occasionally be exposed to dust, high noise level.
* Tolerate a non-temperature controlled environment.
* Steel-toed shoes are required for working in this position.

*Note: Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.**Legrand is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discrimination or harassment.*
If you'd like to work in a fun, creative, business-casual environment that offers a comprehensive benefit package, we encourage you to apply!
Legrand is an equal employment opportunity employer.
For California residents, please see the link for the Privacy Notice for Candidates. California law requires that we provide you this notice about the collection and use of your personal Information.

title: Entry Level Administrative Assistant
description:
Power-Flo Technologies is looking for a full-time **Entry Level** **Administrative Assistant** to join our New Hyde Park location. You will impact the company's operations and organization through data entry while providing exceptional customer service to our customers, vendors, and visitors. You will work closely with our Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Sales, and Operations departments.

  

Power-Flo Technologies is the premiere provider of supplies, services, and solutions to the electrical, industrial, mechanical, and automation industries.

* Sustainability
* Growth

**On the job training provided**

* Provide administrative support to the AR, AP, and Sales departments including but not limited to charging credit cards, pulling invoices, setting up new vendors, and handling emails
* Enter, track, and file ship tickets for various departments

Learn more about us here: https://www.powerflotechnologies.com/

title: Unit Clerk
description:
**Job Statement**

Responsible for routine clerical and administrative duties related to the day-to-day operation of a patient unit. Work involves contact with patients, their families and hospital staff. Responsibilities include scheduling appointments, processing forms, providing information and maintaining detailed records and files.

**Work Schedule:** 8:00 am to 4:30 pm, Monday through Friday.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

1) Maintains clinic appointment calendar on a weekly basis.

2) Provide coverage to other areas as assigned by nursing supervisor.

3) Answers telephone, takes messages and responds to inquiries for routine information.

4) Provides assistance to hospital staff, patients and their families/visitors, providing information and directions.

5) Sets up, maintains, duplicates, tracks, matches and purges records and files in accordance with established procedures and attention to accuracy.

6) Distributes patient rights booklets and informs patients of same and ensures documentation.

7) Completes and processes forms, form letter and other records, charts and activity logs in accordance with established procedures and attention to accuracy.

8) Reviews charts and records for completeness, accuracy, target information or other purposes as directed by supervisor.

9) Maintains communication centers such as the bulletin board.

10) Opens, sorts and distributes incoming mail.

11) Re-orders supplies and replenishes stock to maintain an adequate inventory of supplies and arranges for repair of equipment.

12) Uses computer applications or other automated systems such as spreadsheets, word processing, calendar, e-mail and database software in performing work assignments.

13) Maintains compliance with HIPAA, local, state, federal and other agencies’ rules and regulations.

14) Responsible for preparing, compiling and maintaining patient records at the unit level and performing all clerical duties as directed.

15) Assists in providing supportive administrative services or other duties as assigned.

16) Comply in a timely, honest and quality manner with all Corporate and management reporting requirements, including, but not limited to, DMARS, clinical reporting, Quality reporting, HR and finance reporting requirements.

17) Read, understand and comply with all Diamond policies and procedures, as well as the Diamond and Markel Codes of Conduct.

**Knowledge, Abilities and Skills:**

1) High School diploma or equivalency diploma. College degree preferred.

2) Ability to prepare, organize and maintain accurate records.

3) Ability to effectively use computer applications, such as spreadsheets, word processing, calendar, e-mail and database software.

4) Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing, and to follow oral and written instructions as well as the ability to read and understand English.

5) Ability to work accurately and efficiently under stressful conditions.

6) Ability to deal courteously and effectively with the public and professional staff.

7) Ability to maintain confidential and sensitive information.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Sedentary Work\\* (involves sitting most of the time, occasionally walking and standing; requires lifting no more than 10 pounds at a time and/or occasionally lifting or carrying objects)
* Light Work\\* (involves lifting no more than 20 pounds at a time with frequent lifting or carrying of objects weighing up to 10 pounds; requires moderate mobility to different work locations)
* Medium Work\\* (involves substantial physical activity and mobility; and lifting no more than 50 pounds at a time with frequent lifting or carrying of objects weighing up to 25 pounds.)
* Heavy Work \\*(involves some type of manual labor including operating heavy machinery/ equipment or physical labor; requires lifting no more than 100 pounds at a time with frequent lifting or carrying of objects weighing up to 50 pounds)

**Other Physical Requirements (check all that apply):**

* Blood Bourne Exposure
* Hearing
* Manual Dexterity
* Pushing/Pulling
* Standing, climbing, mobility
* Visual Acuity
* Sitting

title: Closing Assistant Manager
description:
**Join Our Team: Closing Assistant Manager Position Open at Village Super Market, Inc.**

Are you a natural leader with a passion for retail? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy ensuring everything runs smoothly and efficiently? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are seeking an experienced and dedicated Closing Store Manager to oversee the successful end-of-day operations at our retail store. This full-time position offers a competitive salary, alongside a comprehensive benefits package that includes 401(k) with matching, dental, disability, and health insurance, a flexible schedule, paid time off, and paid training. This full-time role requires availability for 10-hour shifts, including weekends and Monday to Friday.

As a Closing Store Manager, you will play a vital role in ensuring the seamless closing of our store each day. Your key responsibilities will include supervising staff, managing cash registers, securing the premises, and maintaining store cleanliness and organization. Your leadership will ensure our store is ready for success the next business day.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead and motivate a team of associates, providing coaching and feedback to enhance performance.
* Complete assigned tasks via task management systems promptly.
* Implement and uphold company standards across all departments.
* Ensure efficient store operations, meeting sales targets and customer service standards.
* Execute and enforce policies related to financial, inventory management, merchandising, safety, security, and compliance.
* Foster a safety culture for all customers and associates.
* Secure the store by locking doors, activating security systems, and conducting a final walkthrough.
* Conduct quick inventory checks and maintain product organization.
* Oversee store cleanliness, ensuring displays and common areas are tidy.
* Address last-minute customer inquiries and ensure all employees complete their tasks before clocking out.
* Provide a nightly report to the store manager or owner and report any maintenance or safety issues.

**Experience and Skills Required:**

* Minimum of 2-3 years' experience in a managerial role within the retail industry.
* Proven track record of effective staff management and operational efficiency.
* Familiarity with inventory management and compliance with health and safety regulations.
* Strong leadership, organizational, and multitasking skills.
* Proficient problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
* Prior experience in grocery retail is preferred.
* Flexibility to work weekends and holidays as needed.
* Customer-focused with a commitment to providing a positive shopping experience.

If you are ready to take your retail career to the next level and contribute to our store's success, apply now to become our Closing Store Manager. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

**Apply today to join the Village Super Market family and make a meaningful impact in the communities we serve.**

title: Practice Manager III
description:
Responsible for supervising daily operations to focus on staff management, responding to physician, patient, and staff concerns, and budget management. Monitors and resolves customer service issues and maximize revenue cycle collections. Establishes and implements shared priorities and goals for providing optimal customer service, increasing operational efficiency, ensuring financial viability, and providing high-quality health care services.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

  

1. Ensures and manages guidelines, policies, and procedures in adherence to the organization and establishes protocols for day-to-day operations.
  

2. Oversees and maintains supplies and equipment and maintains appropriate inventory management and budgetary controls.
  

3. Administers the financial policies and procedures governing cash collections and reconciliation and ensures necessary cash controls are monitored.
  

4. Orients, trains, assigns, schedules, directs, and supervises departmental staff.
  

5. Supervises and manages the exposure of communicable diseases, hazardous materials, and pharmacological agents to minimize risk and follows a standard health precaution.
  

6. Reviews, evaluates, and monitors work schedules, workflow, and duty assignments of the staff and monitors updates when required.
  

7. Monitors patient complaints and issues to identify opportunities for service improvement.
  

8. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare or related field.
  

2. 5 or more years experience in Healthcare or relevant area.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Master's degree in Healthcare or related field.


  
Atlantic Medical Group is a physician-led and physician-governed organization that delivers the highest quality health care, at the right place, the right price, and the right time. We are a multispecialty physician group with more than 1,000 doctors, nurse practitioners and physician assistants at over 300 locations throughout northern and central New Jersey and northeast Pennsylvania. Our mission is to deliver exceptional care recognizing the unique needs of all those we serve. Our vision is to achieve the best outcomes with our patients at the center of the physician-led team, driven by service, innovation and continuous learning.


Our integrated network offers seamless access to Atlantic Health System’s entire health care continuum and our nationally and regionally ranked hospitals. In collaboration with Atlantic Health System, several of our practices offer urgent care and walk-in services.


In addition to primary care physicians, the team includes specialists that care for patients in all aspects of their health from pediatrics to geriatrics and everything in between. We make health decisions easier for patients with enhanced access to referrals.

title: Monitor Technician- FT Days Cardi/Tele 4AB
description:
Responsible for monitoring heart rhythm pattern of patients in special care unit of hospital to detect abnormal pattern variances, using telemetry equipment  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

  

1. Reviews patient information to determine normal heart rhythm pattern, current pattern, and prior variances.
  

2. Observes screen of cardiac monitor and listens for alarm to identify abnormal variation in heart rhythm.
  

3. Informs supervisor or General Duty Nurse of variances to initiate examination of patient.
  

4. Measures length and height of patient's heart rhythm pattern on graphic tape readout, using calipers, and posts information on patient records.
  

5. Answers calls for assistance from patients and inquiries concerning patients from medical staff.
  

6. Prepares documentation regarding evaluation results, progress reports, and personalized treatment plans.
  

7. May perform relevant duties as needed.


  
Required:
  

1. HS Diploma
  

2. Completion of Basic Arrhythmia course required
  

3. Able to pass telemetry pre-test
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Requires critical thinking skills, decisive judgment, and the ability to work with minimal supervision.
  

2. Current Monitor Tech experience and/or recent clinical experience preferred
