title: Franchise Support Coach
company: The Brothers That Just Do Gutters
description:
**The Brothers That Just Do Gutters** in **Poughkeepsie, NY** is actively seeking a motivating and responsible individual to apply for our full-time Franchise Support Coach position. Imagine a job where your organizational, computer, and leadership skills are used and developed daily to help people achieve their goals and dreams. Well, this is that job! We are a fast-growing franchise in need of a person just like you to help new and existing franchisees achieve their goals and dreams through regular support & coaching.


This job supports our Franchise Support Manager in mentoring several franchisees on how to be successful in achieving and exceeding their budgeted goals. The main function of this position encompasses quality support to help our franchisees achieve success by meeting & exceeding their budgeted goals. Over time you will understand all key areas of their business (KPI's) as well as provide input, support, and encouragement. We have a proven system, financial benchmarks, and tools for success which you will learn and implement with remarkable results. We would love to welcome you into our fast-growing organization where fun, learning, support, encouragement, and passion are what drives our people.


Are you self-motivated and goal-oriented? Do you have the desire to work with a company that values and respects you? Are you a collaborative and hardworking individual? If yes, read on about this job!


This coaching position earns a **competitive salary** of **$52,000 per year**. We also provide **great benefits and perks**, including **a 401(k) plan and 2 weeks of paid vacations after 2 years**. If this sounds like the right **Franchise Support Coach** opportunity for you, **apply today**!

 **ABOUT THE BROTHERS THAT JUST DO GUTTERS**


The Brothers That Just Do Gutters is a full-service rain gutter and gutter guard franchise. We repair, install and maintain everything from Seamless Gutter Guards to Specialty Gutters, and it doesn't stop there. No matter the job, our customers know they can count on The Brothers for quality craftsmanship and customer service.


We are big on personal and career growth, loyalty, and caring. We want our team to achieve their goals and aspirations. We fully invest in our team and strive to curate a comfortable work environment. We provide positive, professional, and respectful communication with every fellow employee. Through our provided training, defined career paths, and promotions from within, it is easy to succeed. Our great culture is also supported through **company events** that encourage employee interaction and interpersonal relationships. Don't settle for a fixer-upper career, join us!

 **A DAY IN THE LIFE**


In this Franchise Support Coach position, you provide coaching for a portfolio of Franchise Organizations through monthly accountability calls. Covering all areas of the business, including sales, production, leadership, financial planning & cash flow, meeting formats, vision development, and major KPIs, you maintain a consistent schedule to attend each call. During calls, you provide brand awareness and encourage our members to understand their profit potential. You also assist with planning, coordinating, and creating content for The Brothers Gutters' annual conference, workshops, webinars, and other company events.


You perform deep financial dives with CEOs, identify the root of any problems, and coach to improve performance through company processes. You conduct Quarterly Reviews and build a 90-Day Plan with each Franchisee while encouraging interaction with other members and participation in peer group calls. Using effective coaching strategies, you ensure recruiting bench development is in place, and the company is actively working on an internal growth and succession plan. As an influential leader, you effectively guide and help the franchisees achieve their goals while being their biggest cheerleader!

 **QUALIFICATIONS FOR ENTRY-LEVEL FRANCHISE COACH / GUTTER INSTALLATION & REPAIR**

* Working knowledge of computers, MS Office, QuickBooks, etc. and able to learn a new CRM system
* Able to analyze a financial spreadsheet, P&L, and balance sheets
* Familiar with a variety of field operation concepts, practices, financial health, and procedures
* 2-5 years of experience as a proven coach or consultant, with an emphasis in franchise operations

**Bachelor's degree in Operations, Business Markets, Management, Finance, Supply Chain or related field preferred!** Do you have strong problem-solving and communication skills? Can you effectively resolve conflict? Are you a natural-born leader? Are you an organizational guru with excellent attention to detail? Can you provide exceptional customer service in a fast-paced environment? If yes, we want to meet you!

 **ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR COACHING TEAM?**


If you feel you'll be perfect in this Franchise Support Coach position, **apply now** using our initial **3-minute, mobile-friendly application**.

  

Location: 12603

title: Asistente de salud en el hogar (HHA/PCA) - Se requiere certificado
description:
* **Incare Home Health Care** es un proveedor de atención domiciliaria con licencia del estado de Nueva York que se enorgullece de prestar servicios en los cinco condados. Nuestra agencia cree en brindar atención de calidad que satisfaga la visión y las necesidades de nuestra población de edad avanzada para que puedan envejecer con dignidad y seguridad en la comodidad de su propio hogar.

Estamos buscando asistentes de atención médica domiciliaria (HHA) y asistentes de cuidado personal (PCA) para contratación inmediata. ¡Ofrecemos capacitación de certificación gratuita [¡SOLO para PCA!]  
Puntos destacados de la posición:  
¡El pago comienza desde $18.55!  
Medio Ambiente de la Unión  
Turnos flexibles  
PTO y pago de vacaciones.  
¡Uniformes, mascarillas, guantes, desinfectantes para manos y productos de la empresa gratis!

* **Requisitos:**

Dos pruebas de identificación. (Licencia de conducir o identificación con fotografía que verifique la dirección, tarjeta de Seguro Social, identificación como su pasaporte, tarjeta verde, Visa, etc.).  
Ya debe ser, o estar dispuesto a ser, un asistente certificado de atención médica domiciliaria o de cuidado personal con evidencia de inscripción en el Registro de atención domiciliaria del estado de Nueva York después de completar un programa de capacitación de salud domiciliaria aprobado por el Departamento de Salud del estado de Nueva York.  
Resultados del examen físico previo al empleo/PPD/rubéola/prueba de drogas antes del contacto con el paciente.  
Dos cartas de referencia.

* **Habilidades y Responsabilidades, incluyendo:**

Proporcionar servicios de atención médica dentro de las residencias de los pacientes.  
Realizar tareas domésticas y del hogar básicas.  
Transportar y acompañar a los pacientes al consultorio médico o al hospital.  
Recuerde al cliente que tome los medicamentos recetados.  
Ayudar con las actividades de cuidado personal del cliente.  
Monitoree a los pacientes (es decir, signos vitales, temperatura, respiración) e informe sobre su condición [solo HHA].  
Mantener registros de atención de pacientes y documentar los servicios prestados.  
Proporcionar compañía y apoyo emocional o psicológico básico.  
Naturaleza cariñosa y compasiva con el deseo de cuidar a los demás.  
Mente abierta y madurez emocional hacia personas de diversos orígenes.  
Grandes habilidades interpersonales y de comunicación entre todas las partes involucradas: coordinador de atención, paciente y familiares y equipo de atención extendida (es decir, administrador de atención, trabajador social, enfermera).

**El bilingüismo es una ventaja**.

title: Delivery Associate (Driver)
description:
This is a **Delivery Associate** (driver) position with Zoo Kiss Logistics (the “Company”) delivering packages for a national technology company! We operate out of a Delivery Station in **Avenel, NJ**. We offer **full & part-time** positions.

We are looking for **reliable**, **independent**, **flexible**, **hard workers** who pay attention to details, can quickly **problem solve** a wide range of situations, **communicate** effectively and **win** in a **fast-paced** environment! Successful delivery drivers enjoy being out on the road driving, put safety first and care deeply about customer expectations and satisfaction.

We are looking for enthusiastic team players who desire to grow with the Company

* Military **veterans** are welcome!
* Commercial, DOT, CDL (or work-related) **driving experience is a plus**, but not mandatory
* Shifts range between 8-10 hours per day and shifts are available 7 days per week. **4 day work week (40 hours)** is typical

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* $21.25 - $23 / Hour (paid biweekly)
* Paid **Training**
* Paid **Overtime**
* Medical, Dental, and Vision **insurance**
* **Paid time off** begins accruing immediately at start of employment

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Successfully handle and **deliver** packages **on time**
* **Safely** drive and perform safety **inspections** on Company vehicle
* Follow all local & state laws, road/driving regulations, and Company policies
* Provide **excellent customer service** and satisfaction despite stressful events / conditions
* **Keep pace** in **physically demanding** job; work in all **weather** conditions and on various routes; **lift** packages (up to 50 lbs.); get in and out of a van repeatedly throughout the day at variable locations
* **Communicate effectively** with support team to provide exceptional customer service and ensure deliveries are completed
* Use **smart phone device** for GPS Navigation, scanning packages, conducting administrative requirements such as clocking in/out, and to communicate with supervisors and other team members
* Load and unload packages in delivery vehicle
* Support the team in daily work requirements including participation in rescue calls when other team members need assistance with their routes drive and operate your delivery vehicle at all times.
* Be CUSTOMER OBSESSED!! We strive to deliver packages and smiles to our customers.

**Requirements:**

* Must be **at least 21 years old**
* Must hold a non-provisional, unrestricted driver’s license
* Must be authorized to work in the United States
* Must successfully pass a **4-Panel Drug Screening** (which does not include pre-employment testing for marijuana)
* Must have a **clean motor vehicle report** (multiple violations can disqualify you from the position)
* Must have good English speaking, reading, writing / **communication** skills

**Equipment Provided:**

* Delivery Vehicle & Gas
* Handheld technology
* Uniforms
* Other safety and administrative gear necessary for job accomplishment

**HIRING PROCESS takes approximately 1-2 WEEKS to COMPLETE**. It may take longer if you have an out-of-state driver’s license.

***We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of age, national origin, race, color, disability, religious beliefs, or sexual orientation, or any other protected class status. Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.***

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $21.25 - $23.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Language:

* English (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: In person
